I have visited many places. (Мен көптеген жерлерге барғанмын.)

She has studied English for three years. (Ол ағылшын тілін үш жыл бойы оқып жүр.)
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Hello, Alibek! Have you finished your homework yet?
Alibek: Yes, I have already finished it. I have also studied for the English test.
Teacher: Great! Have you visited Astana?
Alibek: Yes, I have visited Astana several times. It’s very beautiful.
Teacher: And has your sister traveled with you?
Alibek: Yes, she has traveled with me. She has improved her English a lot.
Teacher: How long has your father worked in Astana?
Alibek: He has worked there since 2018. He has lived there for five years.
Teacher: That's nice! And your mother, has she cooked dinner?
Alibek: Yes, she has cooked dinner, and we are going to eat now.

fields.title: Жиі қолданылатын Present Perfect етістіктері (been, gone, done, seen)
fields.content:
Interesting Things I've Done

Hello! My name is Ainur, and I love adventures. I've been to many different cities in Kazakhstan. I've been to Astana, but I've never been to Aktau. My brother has gone to Almaty today, so he isn't home right now. Have you ever done something exciting? I've done many exciting things. I've seen beautiful mountains, and I've seen the sea. My family and I have also been abroad twice. Traveling is the best experience I've ever had.
fields.vocabulary:
adventure – шытырман оқиға

been – болып қайтты, барды (барған және қайтып келген)

gone – кетіп қалды, барды (қайтып келмеген)

done – жасаған (do етістігінің үшінші формасы)

seen – көрген (see етістігінің үшінші формасы)

exciting – қызықты, толқытатын

mountain – тау

sea – теңіз

abroad – шетелде

travel – саяхаттау (traveled)

best – ең жақсы

experience – тәжірибе

ever – бір кездері

twice – екі рет

different – әртүрлі
fields.grammar:
Бұл етістіктер Present Perfect-те жиі кездеседі:

been — адам бір жерге барып, қайта келген кезде қолданылады.

gone — адам бір жерге кетіп, әлі қайтып келмегенде қолданылады.

done — бір нәрсені жасау, аяқтау мағынасын береді.

seen — бір нәрсені немесе біреуді көрген тәжірибені білдіреді.

Мысалдар:

I have been to Almaty. (Алматыда болып қайттым.)

He has gone to Astana. (Ол Астанаға кетті, әлі қайтпады.)

She has done her homework. (Ол үй тапсырмасын жасады.)

I have seen that film twice. (Мен ол фильмді екі рет көрдім.)
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Ainur, have you ever been to Astana?
Ainur: Yes, I've been to Astana many times. It's beautiful.
Teacher: Has your brother been there, too?
Ainur: Actually, he's gone to Almaty today. He's not home now.
Teacher: Have you ever done something very exciting?
Ainur: Yes, I've done many exciting things. I've seen mountains and the sea.
Teacher: Great! Have you been abroad?
Ainur: Yes, my family and I have been abroad twice. It was amazing!
Teacher: What's the best experience you've ever had?
Ainur: Traveling abroad is definitely the best experience I've ever had.

fields.title: Present Perfect vs. Past Simple айырмашылығы
fields.content: My name is Dauren. I visited Almaty last year. I stayed there for two weeks. I have visited Almaty three times. I've seen Medeu, Koktobe, and many beautiful places. Yesterday, I went to the cinema. I've already watched that movie twice.
fields.vocabulary:
visit – бару

stay – тұру (уақытша)

year – жыл

week – апта

already – әлдеқашан

watch – көру

cinema – кинотеатр

twice – екі рет

movie – фильм

yesterday – кеше

last – өткен

beautiful – әдемі

place – орын

see – көру (seen)

three times – үш рет
fields.grammar:
Present Perfect - уақыт белгісіз (I have visited Almaty).
Past Simple - уақыт белгілі (I visited Almaty last year).

Мысалдар:

I've visited Astana three times.

I visited Astana last summer.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Have you ever visited Almaty?
Dauren: Yes, I've visited Almaty three times.
Teacher: When did you visit it last?
Dauren: I visited it last year.

fields.title: Қазірге дейін жасаған әрекеттер (Have you ever...?)
fields.content: My name is Gulnar. I've traveled to Europe. I've tried pizza and sushi. I've ridden a horse. My sister has never traveled by plane. Have you ever visited the USA?
fields.vocabulary:
travel – саяхаттау

Europe – Еуропа

try – байқап көру

pizza – пицца

sushi – суши

ride – міну

horse – ат

sister – әпке, сіңлі

never – ешқашан

plane – ұшақ

USA – АҚШ

visit – бару

ever – бір кездері

traveled – саяхаттады

ridden – мінген
fields.grammar:
"Have you ever + V3?" өмір бойы бір рет болған тәжірибе туралы сұрайды.

Мысалдар:

Have you ever ridden a horse?

I've never visited Italy.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Have you ever traveled abroad?
Gulnar: Yes, I've traveled to Europe.
Teacher: Have you ever ridden a horse?
Gulnar: Yes, I've ridden a horse many times.

fields.title: "Yet", "already", "just" қолданылуы
fields.content: I haven't finished my homework yet. I've already eaten lunch. My brother has just arrived home.
fields.vocabulary:
finish – аяқтау

homework – үй тапсырмасы

yet – әлі

already – әлдеқашан

eat – жеу

lunch – түскі ас

brother – аға, іні

just – жаңа ғана

arrive – келу

home – үй

finished – аяқтады

eaten – жеді

arrived – келді

my – менің

haven't – істемедім (have not)
fields.grammar:
yet: болымсыз сөйлемде, соңында

already: бұрын болған әрекет

just: жақында болған әрекет

Мысалдар:

Have you eaten yet?

I've just arrived.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Have you finished your homework yet?
Student: No, I haven't finished yet. But I've already eaten lunch.

fields.title: Present Perfect көмегімен тәжірибе туралы айту
fields.content: I've climbed mountains. My sister has won competitions. My parents have traveled around Kazakhstan.
fields.vocabulary:
climb – өрмелеу

mountain – тау

sister – әпке, сіңлі

win – жеңу

competition – жарыс

parent – ата-ана

around – айналасында

Kazakhstan – Қазақстан

traveled – саяхаттады

climbed – өрмеледі

won – жеңді

experience – тәжірибе

life – өмір

about – туралы

talk – әңгімелеу
fields.grammar:
Present Perfect өмір бойғы тәжірибені айту үшін қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

I've climbed mountains.

She has won many competitions.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Have you ever won a competition?
Student: Yes, I've won several competitions.

fields.title: How long...? және for/since қолданылуы
fields.content: How long have you studied English? I've studied English for two years. My brother has worked here since January.
fields.vocabulary:
how long – қанша уақыт

study – оқу

English – ағылшын тілі

year – жыл

brother – аға, іні

work – жұмыс істеу

here – осында

since – бастап

January – қаңтар

for – бойы

two – екі

month – ай

learn – үйрену

teach – үйрету

lived – тұрды
fields.grammar:
How long...? – уақытты сұрау
for – уақыт кезеңі
since – нақты уақыт

Мысалдар:

I've lived here for five years.

He's worked here since 2020.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: How long have you studied English?
Student: I've studied English for two years.

fields.title: Present Perfect көмегімен соңғы жаңалықтарды айту (news and recent events)
fields.content: My name is Timur. I have some exciting news to share! My sister has passed her driving test today, and she is very happy. She has dreamed about driving for many years. My best friend, Nurzhan, has moved to a new house recently. He has invited me to visit him this weekend. My father has bought a new car, and we've already traveled to the mountains. It was a fantastic experience! My mother has just finished cooking dinner, and it smells delicious. So many wonderful things have happened this week!
fields.vocabulary:
exciting – қызықты

news – жаңалықтар

share – бөлісу

pass – тапсыру (passed)

driving test – жүргізуші емтиханы

dream – армандау (dreamed)

recently – жақында

invite – шақыру (invited)

buy – сатып алу (bought)

fantastic – керемет

experience – тәжірибе

smell – иісі шығу (smelled)

delicious – дәмді

wonderful – керемет

happen – болу, орын алу (happened)
fields.grammar:
Present Perfect соңғы жаңалықтарды немесе жақында болған оқиғаларды баяндауға қолданылады. Әрекеттің нақты уақыты маңызды емес, бастысы – ол оқиғаның қазіргі уақытқа қатысы бар.

Мысалдар:

My sister has passed her test today.

My father has bought a new car.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Timur, any news to share today?
Timur: Yes, teacher! My sister has passed her driving test. She's very happy!
Teacher: That’s great! Has your father bought a new car recently?
Timur: Yes, he has bought a new car. We've already traveled to the mountains. It was fantastic!
Teacher: Wow! Have you visited your friend’s new house yet?
Timur: Not yet, but he has invited me this weekend. I'm excited!
Teacher: And your mother? Has she finished cooking?
Timur: Yes, she's just finished cooking dinner. It smells delicious!

fields.title: Present Perfect шақты қолданумен әңгіме айту
fields.content: I'm Zhanna, and today I want to tell you about some amazing experiences I've had this year. I've learned how to swim, and I've joined a sports club. My parents have traveled abroad for the first time. They have visited Turkey and enjoyed it a lot. My older brother has graduated from university and has found a good job. We have celebrated his graduation together. My little sister has grown taller, and she has become good at dancing. It has been a wonderful year full of unforgettable experiences!
fields.vocabulary:
amazing – таңғажайып

learn – үйрену (learned)

swim – жүзу

join – қосылу (joined)

sports club – спорт клубы

abroad – шетелде

enjoy – ләззат алу (enjoyed)

graduate – бітіру (graduated)

university – университет

find – табу (found)

job – жұмыс

celebrate – тойлау (celebrated)

grow – өсу (grown)

become – болу, айналу (become)

unforgettable – ұмытылмас
fields.grammar:
Present Perfect бір кезеңдегі өмірлік тәжірибелер мен жетістіктер туралы әңгімелеуде өте жиі қолданылады. Бұл жағдайда нақты уақыт көрсетілмейді, тек тәжірибенің болғандығы маңызды.

Мысалдар:

I've learned how to swim.

My brother has graduated from university.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Zhanna, can you tell us about your experiences this year?
Zhanna: Of course! I've learned how to swim, and I've joined a sports club.
Teacher: That sounds great! Have your parents traveled anywhere interesting?
Zhanna: Yes, they have traveled abroad for the first time. They visited Turkey and really enjoyed it.
Teacher: Wonderful! Has your brother graduated yet?
Zhanna: Yes, he has graduated from university, and he has found a good job.
Teacher: Congratulations! And your little sister?
Zhanna: She has grown taller, and she has become very good at dancing.
Teacher: What a great year you've had!

fields.title: Қайталау сабағы (Present Perfect)
fields.content: This month has been very busy for me. I've started learning to play guitar. I've practiced every day, and I've already learned three songs. My sister has visited Astana for the first time. She has taken many photos there. My parents have celebrated their 20th wedding anniversary this month. They have organized a big party. Many friends and relatives have visited us. I have never seen my parents so happy before! My best friend has invited me to his birthday party tomorrow. I've bought him a gift. This month has brought many happy moments into my life!
fields.vocabulary:
busy – қарбалас

start – бастау (started)

guitar – гитара

practice – жаттығу (practiced)

song – ән

photo – сурет

wedding anniversary – үйлену тойының мерейтойы

organize – ұйымдастыру (organized)

party – кеш, той

relative – туыс

never – ешқашан

invite – шақыру (invited)

birthday – туған күн

gift – сыйлық

moment – сәт
fields.grammar:
Present Perfect өмірлік тәжірибе, жақында болған әрекеттер, бұрын ешқашан болмаған оқиғаларды сипаттау үшін қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

I've learned three songs.

I've never seen my parents so happy.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: You've had a busy month, haven't you?
Student: Yes, I've started learning guitar, and I've already learned three songs.
Teacher: Excellent! Has your sister traveled anywhere recently?
Student: She has visited Astana for the first time and has taken many photos.
Teacher: That's nice. Have your parents celebrated anything special?
Student: Yes, they've celebrated their 20th wedding anniversary. Many friends have visited us.
Teacher: Wonderful! Have you prepared for your friend's birthday?
Student: Yes, I've bought him a gift. I'm very excited about tomorrow!

fields.title: Future Simple шақты тереңдету (will/won't)
fields.content: My name is Dana, and today I'll talk about my future plans. Next year, I'll finish school, and I'll start university. I'll study computer science because I think it will be very interesting. My brother says he'll travel around Europe next summer. I think he'll have a great time. My parents will buy a new house soon, but they won't sell our old house. We'll probably move in September. I hope I'll make many new friends at university.
fields.vocabulary:
future – болашақ

plan – жоспар

finish – аяқтау

university – университет

computer science – компьютер ғылымы

interesting – қызықты

travel – саяхаттау

around – айналасында

Europe – Еуропа

soon – жақында

sell – сату

probably – мүмкін

move – көшу

hope – үміттену

friend – дос
fields.grammar:
Future Simple – болашақта болатын әрекеттер мен болжамдар айту үшін қолданылады. Құрылымы: will + verb (етістіктің негізгі формасы).

Мысалдар:

I'll study computer science.

They won't sell their old house.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Dana, what will you do after finishing school?
Dana: I'll start university. I'll study computer science.
Teacher: That sounds great. Will your brother travel anywhere?
Dana: Yes, he'll travel around Europe next summer.
Teacher: Will your parents move to a new house?
Dana: Yes, they'll buy a new house soon, but they won't sell our old house.

fields.title: Future Continuous шақ: жалпы түсінік (will be + ing)
fields.content: Tomorrow at this time, I'll be traveling to Astana. My sister will be studying at the library, and my parents will be working. I won't be watching TV because I'll be busy. At 8 PM, I'll be having dinner with my friends. It will be an exciting day!
fields.vocabulary:
tomorrow – ертең

travel – саяхаттау (traveling)

study – оқу (studying)

library – кітапхана

work – жұмыс істеу (working)

busy – бос емес

watch – көру (watching)

dinner – кешкі ас

exciting – қызықты

friend – дос

at this time – осы уақытта

tomorrow evening – ертең кешке

have – бар болу (having)

will be – болады

because – өйткені
fields.grammar:
Future Continuous болашақта белгілі бір уақытта орындалып жатқан іс-әрекетті білдіреді.
Құрылымы: will be + verb+ing.

Мысалдар:

Tomorrow at 8 PM, I'll be having dinner.

I won't be watching TV at this time tomorrow.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What will you be doing tomorrow at this time?
Student: I'll be traveling to Astana. My sister will be studying at the library.
Teacher: Will you be watching TV in the evening?
Student: No, I won't be watching TV because I'll be busy. I'll be having dinner with my friends.

fields.title: Future Continuous қолдану арқылы жоспар айту
fields.content: This weekend, we'll be visiting my grandparents in the village. I'll be helping my grandfather in the garden, and my sister will be cooking with my grandmother. My father will be fishing at the lake, and my mother will be reading a book. We won't be using our phones much because we'll be enjoying nature.
fields.vocabulary:
weekend – демалыс күндері

village – ауыл

help – көмектесу (helping)

grandfather – ата

garden – бақша

cook – тамақ дайындау (cooking)

grandmother – әже

fish – балық аулау (fishing)

lake – көл

read – оқу (reading)

book – кітап

use – қолдану (using)

phone – телефон

enjoy – ләззат алу (enjoying)

nature – табиғат
fields.grammar:
Future Continuous шақ болашақтағы нақты жоспарлар туралы айтуға қолайлы.

Мысалдар:

We'll be visiting my grandparents this weekend.

My mother will be reading a book all day.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What are your plans for the weekend?
Student: We'll be visiting my grandparents. I'll be helping my grandfather in the garden.
Teacher: Will you be using your phones there?
Student: No, we won't be using our phones much because we'll be enjoying nature.

fields.title: Used to: өткен шақтағы әдеттер мен жағдайлар
fields.content: When I was a child, I used to play outside every day. My sister used to be very shy, but now she's outgoing. My family used to live in Shymkent, but now we live in Almaty. We used to travel by bus, but now we have a car.
fields.vocabulary:
child – бала

play – ойнау

outside – далада

shy – ұялшақ

outgoing – ашық, көпшіл

family – отбасы

live – тұру

travel – саяхаттау

bus – автобус

car – көлік

when – қашан

used to – бұрын істейтін

now – қазір

every day – күн сайын

but – бірақ
fields.grammar:
"Used to" бұрынғы әдеттер немесе жағдайларды сипаттайды (қазір жоқ).

Мысалдар:

I used to play outside every day.

We used to travel by bus.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Did you use to play outside when you were a child?
Student: Yes, I used to play outside every day.
Teacher: Did your family use to travel by bus?
Student: Yes, we used to travel by bus, but now we have a car.

fields.title: Бұрынғы мен қазіргі әдеттерді салыстыру (used to vs. Present Simple)
fields.content: I used to drink a lot of soda, but now I drink water. My brother used to play video games all day, but now he plays football. My parents used to watch TV in the evening, but now they read books or talk to each other.
fields.vocabulary:
drink – ішу

soda – газдалған сусын

water – су

video games – видео ойындар

football – футбол

watch – көру

TV – теледидар

evening – кеш

read – оқу

book – кітап

talk – сөйлесу

each other – бір-бірімен

now – қазір

a lot of – көп

play – ойнау
fields.grammar:
Used to (бұрынғы әдеттер), Present Simple (қазіргі әдеттер).

Мысалдар:

I used to drink soda, but now I drink water.

My brother used to play video games, but now he plays football.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Did you use to drink soda often?
Student: Yes, I used to drink soda often, but now I prefer water.
Teacher: What about your brother?
Student: He used to play video games all day, but now he plays football instead.

fields.title: First Conditional (If clauses: If + Present Simple, will) кіріспе
fields.content: My name is Alikhan, and today I'll tell you about my plans and ideas. If the weather is nice tomorrow, we'll have a picnic. If it rains, we'll stay at home and watch a movie. If I finish my homework early, I'll visit my friend. My sister says if she passes her exams, our parents will buy her a new phone. I'm sure she'll be happy. If my father comes home early, he'll cook dinner. He cooks really well!
fields.vocabulary:
if – егер

weather – ауа райы

nice – жақсы

picnic – табиғат аясына шығу

rain – жаңбыр жауу

stay – қалу

movie – фильм

finish – аяқтау

homework – үй тапсырмасы

visit – бару, кездесу

pass – тапсыру

exam – емтихан

sure – сенімді

cook – тамақ дайындау

really – шынымен
fields.grammar:
First Conditional нақты болуы мүмкін жағдайларды білдіреді:
Құрылымы: If + Present Simple, will + verb.

Мысалдар:

If the weather is nice, we'll have a picnic.

If I finish homework, I'll visit my friend.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Alikhan, what will you do if it rains tomorrow?
Alikhan: If it rains, we'll stay home and watch a movie.
Teacher: And if your sister passes her exams?
Alikhan: If she passes her exams, our parents will buy her a new phone.

fields.title: Болашақта болуы мүмкін оқиғаларды айту (First Conditional)
fields.content: Tomorrow is a big day! If I get good grades, my parents will take me to a restaurant. If my brother wins the football match, he'll get a new pair of shoes. If my friends arrive on time, we'll start the party early. If the weather is sunny, we'll play games outside.
fields.vocabulary:
big day – маңызды күн

grade – баға

restaurant – мейрамхана

win – жеңу

football match – футбол матчы

pair – жұп

shoes – аяқ киім

arrive – келу

on time – уақытында

party – кеш

early – ерте

sunny – күн шуақты

play – ойнау

games – ойындар

outside – далада
fields.grammar:
First Conditional ықтимал оқиғаларды айту үшін қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

If he wins, he'll get new shoes.

If my friends arrive on time, we'll start early.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What will happen if you get good grades tomorrow?
Student: If I get good grades, my parents will take me to a restaurant.
Teacher: And if your friends arrive on time?
Student: We'll start the party early.

fields.title: If және when қолданудағы айырмашылық
fields.content: If my father comes home early, we'll have dinner together. When my father comes home, we usually have dinner together. If it snows tomorrow, we won't go to school. When it snows, we always play outside.
fields.vocabulary:
if – егер (белгісіздік)

when – қашан (белгілі уақыт)

father – әке

dinner – кешкі ас

together – бірге

early – ерте

usually – әдетте

snow – қар жауу

tomorrow – ертең

always – әрқашан

play – ойнау

outside – далада

home – үй

come – келу

school – мектеп
fields.grammar:
"If" – ықтимал жағдайлар; "When" – міндетті түрде болатын жағдайлар.

Мысалдар:

If it snows tomorrow, we won't go to school.

When it snows, we always play outside.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What will you do if your father comes home early?
Student: If he comes early, we'll have dinner together.
Teacher: And what happens when it snows?
Student: When it snows, we always play outside.

fields.title: Күрделі сөйлемдерде First Conditional қолдану
fields.content: I'm planning a party. If my mother bakes a cake, I'll decorate it. If my friends come early, we'll play some games. If it gets dark early, we'll watch a movie. If everyone enjoys the party, I'll organize another one next month.
fields.vocabulary:
plan – жоспарлау

bake – пісіру

cake – торт

decorate – безендіру

friends – достар

come – келу

game – ойын

get dark – қараңғы түсу

early – ерте

watch – көру

movie – фильм

everyone – бәрі

enjoy – ләззат алу

organize – ұйымдастыру

next month – келесі ай
fields.grammar:
First Conditional күрделі сөйлемдерде болашақтағы ықтимал жағдайларды білдіреді.

Мысалдар:

If it gets dark early, we'll watch a movie.

If everyone enjoys it, I'll organize another party.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What will you do if your friends come early?
Student: If they come early, we'll play some games.
Teacher: And if everyone enjoys the party?
Student: I'll organize another one next month.

fields.title: Future Continuous, Used to, First Conditional
fields.content: Next Sunday, I'll be visiting my grandparents. I used to visit them every weekend when I was younger. If the weather is nice, we'll have a picnic outside. My grandmother will be cooking my favorite food. If my cousin joins us, we'll play football together.
fields.vocabulary:
next Sunday – келесі жексенбі

visit – бару

grandparents – ата-әже

weekend – демалыс күндері

younger – жас кезде

weather – ауа райы

picnic – табиғат аясына шығу

grandmother – әже

cook – тамақ дайындау

favorite – сүйікті

cousin – немере бауыр

join – қосылу

football – футбол

together – бірге

outside – далада
fields.grammar:
Future Continuous (will be + verb+ing)

Used to (бұрынғы әдеттер)

First Conditional (If + Present Simple, will)

Мысалдар:

I'll be visiting my grandparents.

I used to visit them every weekend.

If my cousin joins us, we'll play football.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What did you use to do every weekend when you were younger?
Student: I used to visit my grandparents.
Teacher: What will you do if the weather is nice next Sunday?
Student: We'll have a picnic outside and play football.

fields.title: Cardinal Numbers: жүздіктер, мыңдықтар, миллиондар
fields.content: My city, Almaty, has about two million people. Kazakhstan has more than nineteen million people. The distance from Almaty to Astana is about one thousand two hundred kilometers. My school has five hundred students. My father bought a new phone for one hundred thousand tenge.
fields.vocabulary:
number – сан

million – миллион

thousand – мың

hundred – жүз

distance – қашықтық

kilometer – километр

about – шамамен

more than – одан көп

population – халық саны

buy – сатып алу

phone – телефон

student – оқушы

city – қала

country – ел

tenge – теңге
fields.grammar:
Күрделі сан есімдерді айту:

100 – one hundred

1,000 – one thousand

1,200 – one thousand two hundred

Мысалдар:

Almaty has two million people.

The phone costs one hundred thousand tenge.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What's the population of Kazakhstan?
Student: Kazakhstan has more than nineteen million people.
Teacher: How far is Almaty from Astana?
Student: It's about one thousand two hundred kilometers.

fields.title: Ordinal Numbers: күндер, даталар, реттік орындар
fields.content: My birthday is on the fifth of March. Today is the twenty-first of April. My sister's birthday is on the tenth of November. Kazakhstan's Independence Day is on the sixteenth of December. I came second in the competition.
fields.vocabulary:
ordinal numbers – реттік сан есімдер

first – бірінші

second – екінші

third – үшінші

fifth – бесінші

tenth – оныншы

twenty-first – жиырма бірінші

birthday – туған күн

today – бүгін

November – қараша

December – желтоқсан

Independence Day – Тәуелсіздік күні

competition – жарыс

come – келу

March – наурыз
fields.grammar:
Реттік сан есімдерді жасауда -th, -st, -nd, -rd қосылады:

1st – first

2nd – second

3rd – third

5th – fifth

Мысалдар:

My birthday is on the fifth of March.

I came second in the competition.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: When is Kazakhstan's Independence Day?
Student: It's on the sixteenth of December.
Teacher: When is your birthday?
Student: My birthday is on the fifth of March.

fields.title: Фразалық етістіктерге кіріспе (look for, turn on, turn off)
fields.content: I'm looking for my phone. Can you help me? It's dark in here. Please turn on the light. Don't forget to turn off the TV when you leave the room.
fields.vocabulary:
phrasal verb – фразалық етістік

look for – іздеу

turn on – қосу

turn off – өшіру

phone – телефон

help – көмектесу

dark – қараңғы

here – мұнда

please – өтініш

light – жарық

forget – ұмыту

leave – кету, шығу

room – бөлме

TV – теледидар

find – табу
fields.grammar:
Фразалық етістіктер – бір етістік пен көмекші сөздерден тұратын тіркестер:

look for – something іздеу

turn on – қосу

turn off – өшіру

Мысалдар:

I'm looking for my phone.

Please turn off the TV.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What are you looking for?
Student: I'm looking for my phone.
Teacher: Should I turn on the light?
Student: Yes, please.

fields.title: Күнделікті жиі қолданылатын фразалық етістіктер
fields.content: Every morning, I wake up at 7 o'clock. Then I put on my clothes and go downstairs. After breakfast, I get on the bus to school. In the evening, I come back home and take off my shoes.
fields.vocabulary:
wake up – ояну

put on – кию

clothes – киімдер

go downstairs – төмен түсу

breakfast – таңғы ас

get on – міну (көлікке)

bus – автобус

come back – қайтып келу

home – үй

take off – шешу

shoes – аяқ киім

every morning – әр таң

evening – кеш

after – кейін

downstairs – төменгі қабат
fields.grammar:
Жиі қолданылатын фразалық етістіктер:

wake up (ояну)

put on (кию)

get on (міну)

come back (қайтып келу)

Мысалдар:

I wake up at 7 o'clock.

She put on her shoes quickly.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What do you do after you wake up?
Student: After I wake up, I put on my clothes and go downstairs.
Teacher: How do you go to school?
Student: I get on the bus to school.

fields.title: Фразалық етістіктермен сөйлем құрау
fields.content: Yesterday I ran out of milk, so I went to the shop. I picked up some bread and milk. I came across my friend at the shop, and we talked for a while. Later, I looked after my little brother while my parents went out.
fields.vocabulary:
run out – біту (таусылу)

milk – сүт

shop – дүкен

pick up – алу, көтеру

bread – нан

come across – кездейсоқ кездесу

friend – дос

talk – әңгімелесу

for a while – біраз уақытқа

later – кейінірек

look after – қарау (бағу)

little brother – кіші бауыр

parents – ата-ана

go out – сыртқа шығу

yesterday – кеше
fields.grammar:
Фразалық етістіктерді сөйлем ішінде қолдану мысалдары:

ran out (бітіп қалу)

came across (кездесу)

looked after (қарау, бағу)

Мысалдар:

I ran out of milk yesterday.

I looked after my little brother.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What happened yesterday?
Student: I ran out of milk, so I went to the shop.
Teacher: Did you meet anyone there?
Student: Yes, I came across my friend at the shop.

fields.title: Зат есімнің тәуелдік формасы ('s)
fields.content: Today I'll tell you about my family. This is my father's car. My mother's favorite color is blue. My brother's name is Alikhan, and my sister's hobby is drawing. Our cat's name is Barsik. My friend's house is near our school.
fields.vocabulary:
father – әке

mother – ана

brother – аға, іні

sister – әпке, сіңлі

cat – мысық

friend – дос

car – көлік

favorite – сүйікті

color – түс

hobby – хобби

drawing – сурет салу

near – жақын

house – үй

school – мектеп

family – отбасы
fields.grammar:
Зат есімнің тәуелдік формасы ('s) біреуге немесе бір нәрсеге тиесілілікті білдіреді.

Мысалдар:

My brother's name is Alikhan.

My mother's favorite color is blue.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What's your sister's hobby?
Student: My sister's hobby is drawing.
Teacher: Whose car is that?
Student: That's my father's car.

fields.title: Тәуелділікті білдірудің басқа формалары (of)
fields.content: Astana is the capital city of Kazakhstan. The color of my room is white. The pages of this book are interesting. The name of our school is №45. The capital of France is Paris.
fields.vocabulary:
capital – астана

city – қала

color – түс

room – бөлме

white – ақ

page – бет

book – кітап

interesting – қызықты

name – атау, есім

school – мектеп

France – Франция

Kazakhstan – Қазақстан

Paris – Париж

of – -ның, -нің (тиесілілік)

our – біздің
fields.grammar:
Тәуелділікті білдірудің "of" формасы заттарды сипаттауда жиі қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

The capital of Kazakhstan is Astana.

The pages of this book are interesting.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What's the capital city of France?
Student: The capital of France is Paris.
Teacher: What's the name of your school?
Student: The name of our school is №45.

fields.title: Адамдар арасындағы қарым-қатынасты тәуелдік формамен айту
fields.content: My mother's brother is my uncle. My father's sister is my aunt. My aunt's son is my cousin. My cousin's daughter is my niece. My grandfather's name is Serik, and my grandmother's name is Gulzhan.
fields.vocabulary:
uncle – көке, аға (ананың не әкенің ағасы)

aunt – тәте, апа (ананың не әкенің әпкесі)

cousin – немере аға, әпке, бауыр

niece – жиен (қыз бала)

nephew – жиен (ұл бала)

grandfather – ата

grandmother – әже

son – ұл

daughter – қыз

name – есім

brother – аға, іні

sister – әпке, сіңлі

family – отбасы

my – менің

relation – қарым-қатынас, туыстық
fields.grammar:
Адамдар арасындағы қарым-қатынасты сипаттау үшін 's қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

My mother's brother is my uncle.

My aunt's son is my cousin.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Who is your mother's brother?
Student: My mother's brother is my uncle.
Teacher: Who is your aunt's son?
Student: My aunt's son is my cousin.

fields.title: Жеке заттарды және иеліктерді сипаттау ('s / of айырмашылығы)
fields.content: This is the door of my room. My room's window is big. The color of my brother's bike is red. My friend's dog's name is Max. The keys of the car are lost.
fields.vocabulary:
door – есік

window – терезе

bike – велосипед

dog – ит

key – кілт

lost – жоғалған

big – үлкен

red – қызыл

room – бөлме

brother – аға, іні

friend – дос

car – көлік

name – есім

personal – жеке

thing – зат
fields.grammar:
's (адамдар мен жануарлар), of (заттар).

Мысалдар:

My friend's dog's name is Max.

The keys of the car are lost.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What's your friend's dog's name?
Student: My friend's dog's name is Max.
Teacher: Where are the keys of the car?
Student: The keys of the car are lost.

fields.title: Numbers, Phrasal verbs, Possessive form
fields.content: Yesterday, my father's friend visited us. We ran out of coffee, so my sister went to the shop. She bought two packets of coffee. My friend's birthday is on the twenty-first of June. We'll have a party at my house.
fields.vocabulary:
visit – бару, келу

run out – біту

coffee – кофе

shop – дүкен

packet – пакет

birthday – туған күн

twenty-first – жиырма бірінші

June – маусым

party – кеш

house – үй

friend – дос

buy – сатып алу

yesterday – кеше

father's friend – әкемнің досы

will – болады (келешек шақ)
fields.grammar:
Numbers (twenty-first)

Phrasal verbs (run out)

Possessive ('s): my father's friend

Мысалдар:

My friend's birthday is on the twenty-first of June.

We ran out of coffee.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What happened yesterday?
Student: My father's friend visited us, but we ran out of coffee.
Teacher: Did your sister buy more coffee?
Student: Yes, she bought two packets of coffee at the shop.

fields.title: Directions in the city
fields.content: Today I’m visiting Astana for the first time, and I don't know the city well. I need to find a good restaurant. I stop a friendly woman on the street and ask her, "Excuse me, can you help me? I'm looking for a good restaurant near here." She smiles and replies, "Sure! Go straight ahead until you see a park. Then, turn right at the park and walk about five minutes. You’ll see the restaurant next to a big supermarket." I thank her and start walking. After a few minutes, I find the restaurant easily. The food there is delicious!
fields.vocabulary:
visit – бару, келу

city – қала

know – білу

find – табу

restaurant – мейрамхана

friendly – жылы жүзді, сыпайы

street – көше

straight ahead – тіке алға

park – саябақ

turn – бұрылу

right – оң жақ

walk – жаяу жүру

supermarket – супермаркет

next to – жанында

delicious – дәмді
fields.grammar:
Бағыт беру үшін бұйрық рай қолданылады (Go, turn, walk және т.б.)

Мысалдар:

Go straight ahead and turn right.

Walk about five minutes
fields.dialogue:
Visitor: Excuse me, can you help me? I'm looking for the museum.
Local: Yes, of course! Go straight ahead until you reach the main square. Then, turn left and continue walking. You'll see the museum opposite the hotel.
Visitor: Thank you very much! Is it far from here?
Local: No, it's only about a ten-minute walk.
Visitor: Great, thank you again for your help!
Local: You're welcome! Enjoy your visit!

fields.title: Traveling experiences
fields.content: My name is Marzhan, and I love traveling. Last summer, I visited Turkey with my family. We stayed in a beautiful hotel near the sea. Every day we swam, enjoyed the sun, and visited interesting historical places. One day, we went on a boat trip and saw amazing islands. The local food was very tasty, especially kebabs and baklava. We took a lot of photos and bought souvenirs for our friends. It was an unforgettable trip, and I hope to visit Turkey again.
fields.vocabulary:
travel – саяхаттау

Turkey – Түркия

hotel – қонақүй

sea – теңіз

swim – жүзу

historical – тарихи

boat – қайық

island – арал

amazing – таңғажайып

local – жергілікті

tasty – дәмді

kebab – кәуап

baklava – пахлава

souvenir – кәдесый

unforgettable – ұмытылмас
fields.grammar:
Өткен шақ (Past Simple) саяхат тәжірибесін әңгімелеу үшін қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

Last summer, I visited Turkey.

We stayed in a beautiful hotel.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Marzhan, tell us about your trip to Turkey.
Marzhan: It was amazing! We stayed in a hotel near the sea, swam every day, and visited historical places.
Teacher: Did you go on any special trips?
Marzhan: Yes, we went on a boat trip and saw beautiful islands.
Teacher: How was the food?
Marzhan: The food was delicious! I especially liked kebabs and baklava.
Teacher: Would you like to visit Turkey again?
Marzhan: Yes, definitely. It was unforgettable.

fields.title: At the airport
fields.content: Today I'm flying to London, and I'm at the airport. First, I go to the check-in desk to check my luggage. The agent asks, "Can I see your passport and ticket, please?" After check-in, I go through security. Then, I find my departure gate. While waiting, I buy coffee and a magazine. Soon, they announce boarding, and I show my boarding pass. On the plane, I find my seat easily. It's comfortable, and the flight attendants are friendly. I'm excited to visit London!
fields.vocabulary:
airport – әуежай

check-in – тіркелу

luggage – жүк

agent – қызметкер

passport – паспорт

ticket – билет

security – қауіпсіздік

departure gate – ұшып шығу қақпасы

wait – күту

boarding – ұшаққа отыру

boarding pass – отырғызу талоны

seat – орын

comfortable – ыңғайлы

flight attendant – бортсерік

excited – қуанышты
fields.grammar:
Present Simple әуежайдағы стандартты әрекеттерді сипаттау үшін қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

I go to the check-in desk.

They announce boarding.
fields.dialogue:
Agent: Good morning! Can I see your passport and ticket, please?
Passenger: Here they are.
Agent: Do you have any luggage to check in?
Passenger: Yes, I have one suitcase.
Agent: Thank you. Your gate is number 15, and boarding starts in 30 minutes.
Passenger: Thanks. Is there a café near the gate?
Agent: Yes, there is one next to gate 14.
Passenger: Great, thank you very much!

fields.title: At the hotel
fields.content: I'm checking into a hotel in Astana. At the reception, I say, "Hello, I have a reservation." The receptionist smiles and replies, "Welcome! Can I have your name, please?" After finding my reservation, she gives me the key and says, "Your room number is 305. Breakfast is served from 7 to 10 in the morning. Do you need help with your luggage?" I thank her and ask about Wi-Fi. She explains how to connect and wishes me a nice stay.
fields.vocabulary:
hotel – қонақүй

check-in – тіркелу

reception – қабылдау бөлмесі

reservation – бронь

receptionist – администратор

welcome – қош келдіңіз

breakfast – таңғы ас

served – ұсынылады

luggage – жүк

key – кілт

Wi-Fi – интернет

connect – қосылу

explain – түсіндіру

wish – тілеу

stay – тұру
fields.grammar:
Қонақүйге тіркелу кезінде көбінесе Present Simple шақ қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

Breakfast is served from 7:00 to 10:00.

Your room number is 412.
fields.dialogue:
Receptionist: Welcome to Astana Hotel. Can I have your name, please?
Guest: Yes, my name is Anuar Bekov.
Receptionist: Thank you, Mr. Bekov. Your room is number 305. Breakfast is from 7 to 10 AM. Do you need help with your luggage?
Guest: No, thank you. But could you tell me how to connect to the Wi-Fi?
Receptionist: Of course. Here's the password and instructions. Enjoy your stay!

fields.title: Public transport: bus, train, metro
fields.content: Hello, I'm Aizhan. Today I'll tell you about public transport in Almaty. Public transport here is very convenient and affordable. I usually take the bus to school because it's cheap and stops near my house. The buses arrive every 10 minutes, but sometimes they can be crowded, especially in the morning. My father prefers the metro because it's faster. There are fewer people, and it’s more comfortable. Last weekend, we took the train to visit my grandparents who live outside the city. The train was clean and quiet, and we enjoyed beautiful views during the journey. Overall, I think public transport is a great way to travel around Almaty.
fields.vocabulary:
public transport – қоғамдық көлік

convenient – ыңғайлы

affordable – қолжетімді

bus – автобус

cheap – арзан

stop – аялдама, тоқтау

arrive – келу

crowded – адам көп, толы

metro – метро

prefer – қалау

comfortable – жайлы

train – пойыз

journey – саяхат, сапар

view – көрініс

overall – жалпы алғанда
fields.grammar:
Қоғамдық көлік жайлы күнделікті әдеттерді айту үшін Present Simple қолданылады, ал өткен сапарларды сипаттауда Past Simple қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

I usually take the bus to school.

Last weekend, we took the train to visit my grandparents.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Aizhan, how do you usually go to school?
Aizhan: I usually take the bus because it’s cheap and stops near my house.
Teacher: Do you like traveling by bus?
Aizhan: It's convenient, but sometimes buses are crowded, especially in the morning.
Teacher: What about your father? What transport does he prefer?
Aizhan: He prefers the metro because it's faster and more comfortable.
Teacher: Have you ever traveled by train?
Aizhan: Yes, last weekend we took the train to visit my grandparents outside the city. The train was clean, quiet, and had beautiful views.
Teacher: That sounds nice. Do you think public transport is good in Almaty?
Aizhan: Yes, overall, I think it’s a great way to travel around Almaty.

fields.title: Көлік жүргізу және жол ережелері туралы сөздер
fields.content: Hello, my name is Azamat, and I recently passed my driving test. Driving a car is very exciting, but it's important to know and follow road rules. When you drive, always wear your seatbelt. Stop when the traffic light is red, slow down at yellow, and go when it’s green. It's necessary to check mirrors often and use indicators before turning or changing lanes. Speed limits must be respected to avoid accidents. Pedestrians always have the right of way at crosswalks. If you follow these rules, driving can be safe and enjoyable.
fields.vocabulary:
drive – көлік жүргізу

road rules – жол ережелері

seatbelt – қауіпсіздік белдігі

traffic light – бағдаршам

slow down – баяулау

check – тексеру

mirror – айна

indicator – бұрылыс көрсеткіші

lane – жолақ

speed limit – жылдамдық шегі

accident – жол апаты

pedestrian – жаяу жүргінші

right of way – жолдағы артықшылық

crosswalk – жаяу жүргіншілер өткелі

safe – қауіпсіз
fields.grammar:
Жол ережелері мен міндетті әрекеттер туралы айтуда "must," "have to" сияқты модаль етістіктер қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

You must stop at a red traffic light.

Drivers have to wear seatbelts.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Azamat, congratulations on passing your driving test! What rules must drivers always follow?
Azamat: Thank you! Drivers must always wear seatbelts, stop at red traffic lights, and use indicators before turning.
Teacher: Why is it important to check mirrors?
Azamat: Checking mirrors helps to see other cars, avoid accidents, and drive safely.
Teacher: What about pedestrians?
Azamat: Pedestrians always have the right of way at crosswalks, so drivers must be careful.
Teacher: Good! Drive carefully and stay safe!
Azamat: Thank you very much!

fields.title: Renting a car
fields.content: My family and I visited Astana last month. We decided to rent a car to explore the city. At the car rental office, my father chose a comfortable SUV. The employee asked for my father's driving license, passport, and credit card. He explained the rental conditions and showed us the car. We checked it for any damage before signing the papers. The car was very comfortable, and we easily drove around Astana. Renting a car gave us freedom and flexibility. It was a great experience.
fields.vocabulary:
rent – жалға алу

car rental office – автокөлік жалдау орны

comfortable – жайлы

SUV – жол талғамайтын көлік

employee – қызметкер

driving license – жүргізуші куәлігі

credit card – кредиттік карта

rental conditions – жалға алу шарттары

damage – зақым

sign – қол қою

papers – құжаттар

freedom – еркіндік

flexibility – икемділік

choose – таңдау

explore – зерттеу, аралау
fields.grammar:
Өткен шақтағы әрекеттерді сипаттау үшін Past Simple қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

We rented a car last month.

The employee explained the rental conditions.
fields.dialogue:
Employee: Good afternoon, how can I help you?
Father: We’d like to rent a car for three days.
Employee: What type of car do you prefer?
Father: We'd like an SUV, please.
Employee: Could I see your driving license, passport, and credit card?
Father: Yes, here they are.
Employee: Thank you. Here are the rental conditions. Please check the car for damage before signing the papers.
Father: Everything looks fine.
Employee: Great! Have a nice trip!
Father: Thank you!

fields.title: Қызықты саяхат оқиғаларын баяндау
fields.content: Last year, I traveled to Europe with my friend. One day in Italy, we missed our train to Rome. At first, we felt very upset. But then we met some friendly local people who helped us. They invited us to their house for dinner, and we had delicious Italian food. After dinner, they drove us to the next train station. We learned that sometimes unexpected things make the best memories. It became one of our favorite travel stories.
fields.vocabulary:
travel – саяхаттау

miss – өткізіп алу (жіберіп алу)

train – пойыз

upset – көңілсіз

friendly – жылы жүзді

local – жергілікті

invite – шақыру

delicious – дәмді

Italian – италиялық

station – станция

unexpected – күтпеген

memory – естелік

favorite – сүйікті

story – оқиға, әңгіме

dinner – кешкі ас
fields.grammar:
Өткен оқиғаларды баяндау кезінде Past Simple қолданылады.

Мысалдар:

We missed our train.

They invited us to dinner.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Tell me about a memorable travel experience.
Student: Last year in Italy, my friend and I missed our train to Rome.
Teacher: What did you do?
Student: We felt upset, but then friendly locals invited us to dinner and helped us.
Teacher: Did it turn out to be a good experience?
Student: Yes, it became one of our favorite travel stories.

fields.title: Саяхат жоспарлары және туристік орындар
fields.content: Next summer, my family plans to visit Paris. We’ll see famous tourist places like the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, and Disneyland. My sister wants to take many photos, and I plan to try French food. My parents will visit art galleries and museums. It will be our first trip to France, so we are very excited.
fields.vocabulary:
plan – жоспарлау

tourist – туристік

famous – атақты

Eiffel Tower – Эйфель мұнарасы

Louvre Museum – Лувр мұражайы

Disneyland – Диснейленд

photo – сурет

try – байқап көру

French – француздық

art gallery – өнер галереясы

museum – мұражай

excited – қуанышты

trip – сапар

visit – бару, көру

summer – жаз
fields.grammar:
Келешек шақты (Future Simple) жоспарларды айту үшін қолданамыз.

Мысалдар:

We’ll visit Paris next summer.

My sister will take many photos.
fields.dialogue:
Келешек шақты (Future Simple) жоспарларды айту үшін қолданамыз.

Мысалдар:

We’ll visit Paris next summer.

My sister will take many photos.

fields.title: Travel, Directions, Transport
fields.content: Last month, my friend Kamila visited me in Almaty. She arrived by train early in the morning. Because she didn't know the city, I explained how to use public transport. We took the metro first because it's fast and comfortable. After that, we used a bus to visit the mountains near the city. On the weekend, we rented a car to travel around easily. Kamila enjoyed driving, but I reminded her about important road rules, like stopping at red lights and wearing seatbelts. One day, we lost our way, so we asked a friendly local man for directions. He kindly explained, "Turn left after the bridge, then drive straight ahead until you see the lake." Thanks to his help, we found the place quickly. It was a fantastic trip, and we made many unforgettable memories.
fields.vocabulary:
visit – бару, келу

arrive – келу, жету

train – пойыз

public transport – қоғамдық көлік

metro – метро

comfortable – жайлы

bus – автобус

mountains – таулар

rent – жалға алу

drive – көлік жүргізу

remind – еске салу

road rules – жол ережелері

lose – жоғалту

directions – бағыттар

unforgettable – ұмытылмас
fields.grammar:
Past Simple: өткен оқиғаларды айту үшін қолданылады.

Modal verbs (must/have to): міндетті әрекеттер үшін қолданылады.

Directions: жол көрсету үшін бұйрық рай қолданылады (Turn, go, drive).

Мысалдар:

We rented a car last weekend. (Past Simple)

Drivers must stop at red lights. (Modal verb)

Turn left after the bridge. (Directions)
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: How was Kamila’s visit last month?
Student: It was great! She arrived by train early in the morning.
Teacher: Did you use public transport?
Student: Yes, we used the metro and buses to visit different places.
Teacher: Did you rent a car during her visit?
Student: Yes, we rented a car on the weekend. Kamila enjoyed driving.
Teacher: Did you have any problems finding your way?
Student: Once we lost our way, but a friendly local man gave us directions. He said, "Turn left after the bridge, then drive straight ahead until you see the lake." We quickly found the place.
Teacher: Sounds like a wonderful trip!
Student: It really was. We made many unforgettable memories.

fields.title: Тойлар мен салт-дәстүрлер туралы әңгімелеу
fields.content: My name is Aruzhan, and today I want to tell you about Kazakh traditions and celebrations. In Kazakhstan, weddings are very important and usually large events. Families invite many relatives and friends. Traditional dishes like beshbarmak and kuyrdak are served. People wear traditional clothes, and there's always music and dancing. Another important tradition is Nauryz, celebrated on the 22nd of March. On this day, people prepare special food like Nauryz kozhe, visit each other, and wish happiness and prosperity. These traditions help us stay connected to our culture and history.
fields.vocabulary:
tradition – дәстүр

celebration – той, мереке

wedding – үйлену тойы

invite – шақыру

relative – туыс

dish – тағам

beshbarmak – бешбармақ

kuyrdak – қуырдақ

traditional – дәстүрлі

clothes – киім

prosperity – береке, молшылық
fields.grammar:
Present Simple (әдеттер мен дәстүрлерді сипаттау үшін қолданылады).

Мысалдар:

People wear traditional clothes.

Families invite many relatives.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Can you tell us about a popular Kazakh tradition?
Aruzhan: Yes, weddings are very important. Families invite many relatives, cook traditional dishes like beshbarmak, and enjoy dancing.
Teacher: What about Nauryz? How do people celebrate it?
Aruzhan: People prepare Nauryz kozhe, visit each other, and wish happiness and prosperity.

fields.title: World celebrations and festivals
fields.content: Hello! I'm Bekzat, and today I'll talk about famous world festivals. Christmas, celebrated on the 25th of December, is popular around the world. Families exchange gifts, decorate their homes, and have special meals. In China, people celebrate the Lunar New Year. Streets are decorated with red lanterns, and families enjoy traditional foods like dumplings. Another famous festival is Diwali, celebrated in India. It’s called the "Festival of Lights," and people decorate houses with candles and lamps. These festivals bring people together and create happy memories.
fields.vocabulary:
festival – мереке, фестиваль

Christmas – Рождество

gift – сыйлық

decorate – безендіру

meal – ас, тағам

Lunar New Year – Ай күнтізбесі бойынша жаңа жыл

lantern – шамшырақ, фонарь

memory – естелік

create – жасау, құру
fields.grammar:
Present Simple – әдеттегі әрекеттерді сипаттау үшін.

Мысалдар:

Families exchange gifts on Christmas.

People decorate houses during Diwali.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What do people do during Christmas?
Bekzat: Families exchange gifts, decorate homes, and have special meals.
Teacher: What about Diwali?
Bekzat: It's called the "Festival of Lights." People decorate houses with candles and lamps.

fields.title: Shopping for clothes)
fields.content: Yesterday, I went shopping for new clothes. At the store, I asked the assistant, "Can I try on this shirt, please?" She showed me the fitting room. Unfortunately, the shirt was too small. I asked, "Do you have this in a bigger size?" She brought me a larger size, and it fit perfectly. Then I asked, "How much does it cost?" She replied, "It's 10,000 tenge." I decided to buy it because the quality was good.
fields.vocabulary:
shopping – шопинг

clothes – киім

assistant – сатушы көмекшісі

try on – киіп көру

shirt – көйлек (жиде)

fitting room – киім өлшейтін бөлме

small – кішкентай

large – үлкен

unfortunately – өкінішке орай

decide – шешім қабылдау
fields.grammar:
Past Simple (киім сатып алу кезінде болған жағдайларды сипаттау үшін).

Мысалдар:

Yesterday, I went shopping.

The shirt was too small.
fields.dialogue:
Assistant: Can I help you?
Customer: Yes, please. Can I try on this shirt?
Assistant: Certainly, the fitting room is over there.
Customer: It's too small. Do you have a bigger size?
Assistant: I'll bring you a larger size. How is it now?
Customer: It fits perfectly. How much does it cost?
Assistant: It's 10,000 tenge.
Customer: Great, I'll take it.

fields.title: Prices, asking and paying
fields.content: Last weekend, I went to a bookstore. I found an interesting book and asked the seller, "Excuse me, how much is this book?" He answered, "It's 5,000 tenge." I asked, "Do you accept credit cards?" He said yes. I paid by card and got my receipt. I thanked the seller and left the shop happy with my purchase.
fields.vocabulary:
bookstore – кітап дүкені

interesting – қызықты

seller – сатушы

accept – қабылдау

credit card – кредиттік карта

pay – төлеу

card – карта

receipt – чек

purchase – сатып алынған зат

weekend – демалыс күндері

price – баға

ask – сұрау

answer – жауап беру

leave – кету

happy – бақытты, қуанышты
fields.grammar:
Past Simple (дүкенде болған оқиғаларды сипаттау үшін қолданылады).

Мысалдар:

I asked, "How much is this book?"

I paid by card.
fields.dialogue:
Customer: Excuse me, how much is this book?
Seller: It's 5,000 tenge.
Customer: Do you accept credit cards?
Seller: Yes, we do.
Customer: Great, I'll pay by card.
Seller: Here’s your receipt. Thank you!
Customer: Thank you!

fields.title: Restaurant: reserving a table
fields.content: Today, I decided to reserve a table at a new restaurant in the city. I called the restaurant, and a friendly receptionist answered, "Good afternoon, welcome to Astana Grill, how may I assist you?" I said, "Hello, I'd like to reserve a table for five people at 8:00 tonight." She checked quickly and replied, "Certainly, may I have your name, please?" I answered, "My name is Arman." She confirmed, "Thank you, Mr. Arman. Your table for five people is reserved at 8:00 tonight. Do you have any special requests?" I asked for a table near the window. She said, "No problem, I'll arrange that. We look forward to seeing you."
fields.vocabulary:
reserve – тапсырыс беру

table – үстел

receptionist – қабылдаушы

assist – көмектесу

tonight – бүгін кешке

confirm – растау

special request – ерекше өтініш

arrange – ұйымдастыру

quickly – жылдам

friendly – сыпайы, мейірімді

decide – шешім қабылдау

restaurant – мейрамхана
fields.grammar:
Future Simple (will) — болашақта болатын әрекеттер туралы айтқанда қолданылады.

I'll arrange that. (Мен оны ұйымдастырамын.)
Present Simple — нақты фактілер мен расталған жоспарлар үшін қолданылады.

Your table is reserved. (Сіздің үстеліңіз брондалды.)
fields.dialogue:
Receptionist: Good afternoon, Astana Grill, how may I assist you?
Arman: I'd like to reserve a table for five at 8:00 tonight.
Receptionist: Certainly. May I have your name, please?
Arman: Arman. Could we have a table near the window?
Receptionist: No problem, Mr. Arman. Your table is reserved, and I'll arrange the table near the window. We look forward to seeing you.
Arman: Thank you very much!

fields.title: Ordering food and asking questions
fields.content: Yesterday evening, my family and I went to Astana Grill. When we sat down, the waiter brought menus and asked, "Would you like something to drink first?" My father ordered tea, my mother chose coffee, and I asked for orange juice. The waiter returned and asked, "Are you ready to order your meal?" I asked, "Could you tell me about today’s special dish?" He explained, "Today's special is grilled chicken with vegetables." I ordered that, and my parents chose steaks. We enjoyed the delicious food very much.
fields.vocabulary:
waiter – даяшы

menu – мәзір

order – тапсырыс беру

tea – шай

coffee – кофе

orange juice – апельсин шырыны

meal – тағам

special dish – арнайы тағам

grilled – қуырылған

chicken – тауық еті

vegetables – көкөністер

steak – стейк

delicious – дәмді

choose – таңдау

explain – түсіндіру
fields.grammar:
Could – сұрақ қоюда сыпайылық үшін қолданылады.

Could you tell me about today’s special dish?
fields.dialogue:
Waiter: Are you ready to order?
Customer: Could you tell me about today’s special dish?
Waiter: It’s grilled chicken with vegetables.
Customer: I'll have the special, please.
Waiter: Great choice!

fields.title: Describing dishes on the menu
fields.content: Today, my friend and I visited a café. The waiter described the menu clearly. He said, "We have creamy mushroom soup, spicy chicken salad, and grilled salmon." I chose grilled salmon because I love seafood. My friend ordered the spicy chicken salad because she likes spicy food. Everything was tasty, fresh, and beautifully presented.
fields.vocabulary:
café – кафе

soup – сорпа

spicy – ащы

salad – салат

grilled – қуырылған

salmon – албырт балығы

seafood – теңіз өнімдері

fresh – жаңа

beautifully – әдемі

presented – ұсынылған

clearly – анық

describe – сипаттау
fields.grammar:
Adjectives (сын есімдер) тағамдарды сипаттау үшін қолданылады.

Creamy soup, spicy salad, grilled salmon.
fields.dialogue:
Waiter: May I describe today's menu?
Customer: Yes, please.
Waiter: We have creamy mushroom soup, spicy chicken salad, and grilled salmon.
Customer: I'll take grilled salmon, please.

fields.title: Talking on the phone
fields.content: Yesterday, I called my friend. When he answered, I said, "Hello, this is Erlan. May I speak to Ali, please?" He replied, "Hi, Erlan, speaking." We talked about our homework and planned to meet later.
fields.vocabulary:
call – қоңырау шалу

answer – жауап беру

speak – сөйлесу

reply – жауап қайтару

phone – телефон

conversation – әңгіме
