fields.grammar: "May I speak to…?" – телефонда сыпайы сөйлесу.
fields.dialogue:
Caller: May I speak to Ali, please?
Receiver: Ali speaking. How can I help you?

fields.title: Arranging meetings on the phone
fields.content: Today, I called my friend Aslan to arrange a meeting to discuss our school project. When he picked up the phone, I said, "Hello, Aslan, it's Amir speaking. Do you have some free time tomorrow to meet?" Aslan replied, "Hi, Amir! Yes, I'm available tomorrow afternoon. What time works best for you?" I suggested, "How about meeting at 2 PM at the city library?" He agreed, saying, "That’s perfect. I’ll bring my laptop so we can work effectively." We confirmed our plans and ended the call. Arranging meetings over the phone is easy and convenient.
fields.vocabulary:
arrange – ұйымдастыру

meeting – кездесу

discuss – талқылау

project – жоба

pick up – телефонды көтеру

available – қолжетімді, бос

suggest – ұсыну

agree – келісу

laptop – ноутбук

effectively – тиімді

confirm – растау

convenient – қолайлы

library – кітапхана

tomorrow – ертең

afternoon – түстен кейін
fields.grammar:
Present Simple кездесуді жоспарлау және уақытты келісу кезінде қолданылады.

Are you available tomorrow?

Future Simple (will) жоспарларды растау және келісу кезінде қолданылады.

I’ll bring my laptop.
fields.dialogue:
Amir: Hello, Aslan, it’s Amir speaking. Do you have some free time tomorrow to meet?
Aslan: Hi, Amir! Yes, I’m available tomorrow afternoon. What time works best for you?
Amir: How about meeting at 2 PM at the city library?
Aslan: That’s perfect. I’ll bring my laptop so we can work effectively.
Amir: Great! See you then.
Aslan: See you tomorrow!

fields.title: Celebrations, Shopping, Restaurant, Telephone
fields.content: Last Saturday was my sister's birthday. We celebrated it at her favorite restaurant. Before going there, I called the restaurant to reserve a table. On the phone, the receptionist politely asked, "How many people will come?" I replied, "Six people." We went shopping earlier that day to buy new clothes. At the restaurant, the waiter described delicious dishes from the menu, and we ordered steaks, salads, and desserts. We enjoyed the tasty food, talked a lot, laughed, and took many photos. It was a wonderful celebration!
fields.vocabulary:
celebrate – тойлау

birthday – туған күн

favorite – сүйікті

restaurant – мейрамхана

reserve – тапсырыс беру, брондау

receptionist – қабылдаушы

politely – сыпайы түрде

shopping – сатып алу, шопинг

clothes – киім

waiter – даяшы

delicious – дәмді

steak – стейк

dessert – десерт, тәтті

laugh – күлу

wonderful – керемет, тамаша
fields.grammar:
Past Simple өткен оқиғаларды және іс-әрекеттерді әңгімелеу үшін қолданылады.

We celebrated her birthday.

We went shopping earlier.

Future Simple (will) телефонмен кездесуді жоспарлау немесе тапсырыс беруде қолданылады.

How many people will come?
fields.dialogue:
Receptionist: Good afternoon, Golden Café. How can I help you?
Me: Hello, I’d like to reserve a table for tonight.
Receptionist: Certainly. How many people will come?
Me: Six people, please.
Receptionist: And your name, please?
Me: My name is Dias.
Receptionist: Thank you, Dias. Your table is reserved. We look forward to seeing you tonight!
Me: Thank you very much!

fields.title: Introduction to Past Perfect
fields.content:
“Before I arrived…”

Last Saturday, I went to my friend’s birthday party. When I arrived at the restaurant, most of the guests had already come. They had decorated the room with balloons and lights. My friend had prepared a big cake and ordered delicious food. I was surprised because everything looked perfect. I gave him a gift, and he smiled, saying, “Thanks! I had really wanted this!” Later that evening, we watched a video of our
fields.vocabulary:
arrive – келу

guest – қонақ

decorate – безендіру

balloon – шар

light – жарық

prepare – дайындау

order – тапсырыс беру

delicious – дәмді

surprise – таңғалу

perfect – тамаша

gift – сыйлық

smile – күлімдеу

childhood – балалық шақ

realize – түсіну

grow – өсу

memory – естелік

already – әлдеқашан

before – бұрын

had + V3 – Past Perfect формасы

full of – толы
fields.grammar:
Past Perfect Tense
🔹 Қолданылуы:
Past Perfect — өткен шақтағы екі оқиғаның ішіндегі бұрын болғанын көрсету үшін қолданылады.

🔹 Құрылымы:
Subject + had + Past Participle (V3)

🔹 Мысалдар:
I arrived at the party.

The guests had already come. (Қонақтар мен келгенге дейін келіп қойған болатын.)

She had finished her homework before the movie started.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: Hey, how was your friend’s birthday party?
Dias: It was great! When I arrived, everyone had already come.
Aliya: Oh, so you were late?
Dias: Not really, just a bit. But they had already decorated everything and even prepared the cake!
Aliya: Wow! What did you give him?
Dias: I gave him a book he had really wanted for a long time.
Aliya: That’s so thoughtful of you!
Dias: Yeah, and later we watched a childhood video. I realized how much we had changed.

fields.title: Past Perfect vs. Past Simple
fields.content: Last Friday, I had an important meeting at work. I left home early, but the traffic was terrible. By the time I arrived at the office, the meeting had already finished. My manager had spoken to the team and left the room. I was very disappointed. Later, I met my colleague and asked, “What happened during the meeting?” He said, “The boss talked about the new project, but you had missed the important part.” I felt bad because I had prepared a lot for that meeting.
fields.vocabulary:
important – маңызды

meeting – жиналыс

traffic – жол кептелісі

arrive – келу

already – әлдеқашан

finish – аяқтау

speak – сөйлеу

leave – кету

disappointed – көңілі қалу

colleague – әріптес

miss – өткізіп алу

happen – болу

project – жоба

prepare – дайындау

early – ерте

terrible – қорқынышты, нашар

by the time – сол уақытқа дейін

feel bad – өзіңді жайсыз сезіну

new – жаңа

compare – салыстыру
fields.grammar:
Past Perfect vs. Past Simple
Біріншіден кейін болған іс
I arrived at the office.

Бұрын болған іс
The meeting had finished before I arrived.
🔹 Қолдану тәртібі:
Past Simple — өткенде болған негізгі әрекеттерді айту үшін

Past Perfect — сол әрекеттен бұрын болған оқиғаларды сипаттау үшін

🔹 Мысалдар:
She had left before I arrived.

I had finished dinner when my friend called me.

He didn’t understand because he hadn’t read the article.
fields.dialogue:
Nurzhan: You look upset. What happened this morning?
Aruzhan: I was late to school. When I got there, the test had already started.
Nurzhan: Oh no! Did the teacher let you in?
Aruzhan: No, she had explained the rules earlier: no late students during tests.
Nurzhan: That’s tough.
Aruzhan: I know. I had studied all night, but it didn’t help because I was late.

fields.title: Understanding Past Perfect Continuous
fields.content: Yesterday, my train was delayed for two hours. I was very tired because I had been waiting at the station since early morning. Many other people were also waiting. Some of them had been reading books, while others had been talking or drinking coffee. When the train finally arrived, everyone was relieved. I realized that I had been sitting on the same bench for more than three hours! It was a long and boring morning, but I used the time to relax and think.
fields.vocabulary:
delay – кешігу

train – пойыз

tired – шаршаған

wait – күту

station – вокзал

early – ерте

read – оқу

talk – сөйлесу

drink – ішу

coffee – кофе

finally – ақыры

arrive – келу

relieved – жеңілдеген

realize – түсіну

bench – орындық

more than – одан көп

boring – жалықтыратын

relax – демалу

since – ...бастап

for – ...бойы
fields.grammar:
Past Perfect Continuous — өткен шақтағы ұзақ уақытқа созылған әрекетті сипаттау үшін қолданылады. Әдетте "for", "since", "before", "when" секілді уақыт сөздерімен бірге келеді.

🔹 Құрылымы:
Subject + had been + verb-ing

🔹 Мысалдар:
I had been waiting for two hours before the train arrived.

She had been studying all night, so she was very tired.

They had been working on the project since Monday.
fields.dialogue:
Madi: You look exhausted. What happened?
Dana: I waited for the train all morning. It was delayed!
Madi: Really? How long had you been waiting?
Dana: I had been waiting for more than three hours!
Madi: That’s terrible. What did you do while waiting?
Dana: I had been reading a book and watching people. Some were calm, others were angry.
Madi: I hope your journey was good after that.
Dana: Yes, finally! But I had been sitting on a hard bench for so long, my back still hurts.

fields.title: Second Conditional
fields.content: Amina is having a problem with her classmate. He borrowed her book last week and still hasn’t returned it. She feels uncomfortable asking for it back. I told her, "If I were you, I would talk to him directly." She said, "But what if he gets angry?" I replied, "He won’t. If he were a good friend, he would understand." Amina thought about it and later said, "You’re right. If I didn't say anything, I would feel worse." In the end, she talked to him and everything was fine.
fields.vocabulary:
borrow – қарызға алу

return – қайтару

uncomfortable – ыңғайсыз

directly – тікелей

angry – ашулы

understand – түсіну

think – ойлау

say – айту

worse – нашарлау

in the end – соңында

problem – мәселе

advice – кеңес

classmate – сыныптас

feel – сезіну

talk – сөйлесу

right – дұрыс

would – болар еді

if – егер

were – еді (to be-дің шартты түрі)

didn’t – істемеді
fields.grammar:
Second Conditional (If + Past Simple, would + verb)
🔹 Қолданылуы:
Егер қазір немесе болашақта шынайы емес жағдай туралы айтқымыз келсе, Second Conditional қолданылады.

🔹 Құрылымы:
If + Past Simple, would + verb

If I were you, I would tell the truth.

If he had more time, he would help us.

If she didn’t like the movie, she would leave.

Ескерту: “If I were you” — бұл тұрақты форма. "Was" емес, "were" қолданылады.
fields.dialogue:
Miras: I don’t know what to do. I lost my friend’s headphones.
Aliya: Oh no! That’s not good.
Miras: I feel so bad. I can’t tell him.
Aliya: If I were you, I would be honest and explain what happened.
Miras: But what if he gets upset?
Aliya: If he were a real friend, he would understand.
Miras: Yeah, maybe you’re right. If I hid the truth, it would be worse.

fields.title: Second Conditional қолдану: кеңес беру және қияли (unreal) жағдайлар
fields.content:
If I won the lottery, I would travel around the world. I’d visit countries like Japan, Brazil, and New Zealand. I wouldn’t work for a year — I’d just relax, read books, and enjoy life. If I had a private island, I would build a small eco-friendly house there. I know it's just a dream, but it's fun to imagine.
Sometimes, I also use this structure to give advice. For example, if my friend feels sad, I say, "If I were you, I would talk to someone." Second Conditional is great for expressing dreams, wishes, and advice.
fields.vocabulary:
win – жеңу

lottery – лотерея

travel – саяхаттау

around the world – бүкіл әлем бойынша

visit – бару

wouldn’t – істемес еді

just – тек қана

relax – демалу

imagine – елестету

private – жеке

island – арал

build – салу

eco-friendly – экологиялық таза

advice – кеңес

structure – грамматикалық құрылым

dream – арман

wish – тілек

give – беру

express – білдіру

fun – қызықты
fields.grammar:
Second Conditional — болашақта болуы мүмкін емес, немесе қазір шындыққа жанаспайтын қияли жағдайлар мен кеңестер үшін қолданылады.

🔹 Құрылымы:
If + Past Simple, would + verb

🔹 Кеңес айту:
If I were you, I would tell the truth.

If I were her, I wouldn’t worry so much.

🔹 Қияли жағдайлар:
If I had a million dollars, I would buy a big house.

If we lived on the beach, we would swim every day.

📝 Ескерту:
"Was" орнына "were" барлық жақта (I, he, she) қолданылады:
If I were you, not If I was you
fields.dialogue:
Ainur: If you could live anywhere in the world, where would you live?
Erzhan: I think I’d live in Switzerland. If I lived there, I would go hiking every weekend.
Ainur: That sounds amazing. What would you do if you had a lot of money?
Erzhan: I would build a mountain house and travel the world.
Ainur: And if you were a celebrity?
Erzhan: I would help people and start a charity.

fields.title: Passive Voice (ырықсыз етіс) — Present Simple және Past Simple
fields.content: At our office, the cleaning is done regularly. The floor is cleaned every morning before we arrive. Trash is taken out by the cleaner, and the tables are wiped carefully. Yesterday, a special team came. All windows were washed, and the carpets were vacuumed. Our manager was happy and said, “The office looks great!” It’s important that shared spaces are kept clean, and we all try to help.
fields.vocabulary:
clean – тазалау

every day – күн сайын

floor – еден

trash – қоқыс

wipe – сүрту

carefully – мұқият

special – арнайы

window – терезе

wash – жуу

carpet – кілем

vacuum – шаңсорғышпен тазалау

manager – басшы

look – көріну

shared – ортақ

space – кеңістік

keep – сақтау

help – көмектесу

regularly – тұрақты түрде

team – топ

come – келу
fields.grammar:
Passive Voice — әрекет жасаушы белгісіз немесе маңызды емес болғанда қолданылады.

🔹 Present Simple Passive:
am / is / are + V3

The room is cleaned every day.

🔹 Past Simple Passive:
was / were + V3

The windows were washed yesterday.
fields.dialogue:
Diana: Our office looks so clean today!
Nurlan: Yes, it was cleaned yesterday by a professional team.
Diana: I noticed the carpets too.
Nurlan: They were vacuumed, and the windows were washed.
Diana: Amazing! Do they clean it every day?
Nurlan: Yes, normally the room is cleaned in the morning.

fields.title: Passive Voice — Present Continuous және Future
fields.content:
Right now, the wedding hall is being decorated. Flowers are being arranged, and tables are being set up. In the kitchen, food is being prepared by top chefs. Everything looks beautiful.
Tomorrow, the bride and groom will be welcomed by all the guests. Speeches will be given, and music will be played. The entire event will be organized professionally. Everyone is excited for the big day.
fields.vocabulary:
prepare – дайындау

decorate – безендіру

arrange – орналастыру

set up – орналастыру

chef – аспаз

wedding – той

bride – қалыңдық

groom – күйеу жігіт

guest – қонақ

speech – сөз сөйлеу

play – ойнау

organize – ұйымдастыру

entire – толық

professionally – кәсіби түрде

event – оқиға

being – ...болуда

will be – болады

right now – дәл қазір

tomorrow – ертең

excited – қуанышты
fields.grammar:
Present Continuous Passive:
am / is / are + being + V3

The food is being prepared now.

🔹 Future Passive:
will be + V3

The speech will be given tomorrow.
fields.dialogue:
Alua: What’s happening in the hall?
Dias: It is being decorated for the wedding.
Alua: Are they preparing food now?
Dias: Yes, it is being prepared by top chefs.
Alua: What will happen tomorrow?
Dias: The couple will be welcomed, and music will be played.

fields.title: Passive Voice қолдану — жаңалықтар мен ақпаратта
fields.content:
A new school has been opened in the city center. It was built by a team of international architects. The building is equipped with modern classrooms, smart boards, and science labs. More than 500 students are expected to study there.
In the opening ceremony, a speech was given by the Minister of Education. He said, “New opportunities are being created for future generations.” The school will be supported by the government for the next 5 years.
fields.vocabulary:
open – ашу

build – салу

architect – сәулетші

equipment – жабдық

smart board – ақылды тақта

science lab – зертхана

expect – күту

ceremony – салтанат

minister – министр

opportunity – мүмкіндік

generation – ұрпақ

support – қолдау

government – үкімет

future – болашақ

modern – заманауи

create – құру

education – білім

city center – қала орталығы

classroom – сынып

next – келесі
fields.grammar:
Жаңалықтарда Passive Voice жиі қолданылады.

A new project has been launched.

It was built last year.

Jobs will be created next month.
fields.dialogue:
Newsreader: A new school has been opened downtown.
Listener: That’s great! Who was it built by?
Newsreader: It was built by international architects and will be supported by the government.

fields.title: Past Perfect және Second Conditional
fields.content:
Last week, I missed my bus because I woke up late. If I had woken up earlier, I wouldn’t have missed it. I was late to work, and my boss was angry. If I had finished my project on time, she would have been happy.
I learned my lesson: If I were more organized, my life would be easier. Now I go to sleep earlier and set two alarms.
fields.vocabulary:
had woken up

would have missed

had finished

would have been

were

would be

alarm – оятқыш

organized – тәртіпті

lesson – сабақ (тәжірибе)

project – жоба
fields.grammar:
Past Perfect: had + V3

Second Conditional: If + Past Simple, would + V1

Third Conditional (енгізу ретінде): If + Past Perfect, would have + V3
fields.dialogue:
Ainur: You looked stressed yesterday.
Adil: Yes, I was late. If I had woken up on time, I wouldn’t have missed the bus.
Ainur: If I were you, I would set more alarms.
Adil: I already did!

fields.title: Passive Voice
fields.content:
This week, many events were organized at our university. A career fair was held, where companies were invited to meet students. Workshops were conducted on leadership and communication.
Next week, more sessions will be arranged, and certificates will be given to all participants. Education here is taken seriously, and students are encouraged to take part actively.
fields.vocabulary:
organize – ұйымдастыру

career fair – жұмыс жәрмеңкесі

invite – шақыру

conduct – өткізу

leadership – көшбасшылық

communication – қарым-қатынас

session – сессия, шара

certificate – сертификат

participant – қатысушы

encourage – ынталандыру
fields.grammar:
Барлық Passive Voice формаларын қайталау:

Present Simple Passive: is given

Past Simple Passive: was organized

Present Continuous Passive: is being prepared

Future Passive: will be held

Present Perfect Passive: has been opened
fields.dialogue:
Student A: Did you go to the career fair?
Student B: Yes! It was held yesterday. Many companies were invited.
Student A: Will there be more sessions?
Student B: Yes, more workshops will be arranged next week.

fields.title: Reported Speech (жанама сөйлем) — Кіріспе
fields.content:
Yesterday, my friend Aigerim told me something interesting. She said, “I’m moving to another city next month.” I was surprised, but I understood her reason. Later, when I spoke to our classmates, I told them, “Aigerim said she was moving to another city next month.”
Reported speech is used when we share what someone else said. Instead of repeating the exact words, we change the sentence into the past. For example, “I am tired” becomes “She said she was tired.” It's important to understand how to use this form, especially when reporting conversations or stories.
fields.vocabulary:
tell – айту

said – айтты

move – көшу

city – қала

next month – келесі ай

surprised – таңғалған

reason – себеп

speak – сөйлесу

classmate – сыныптас

report – баяндау

conversation – әңгіме

exact – нақты

change – өзгерту

past – өткен шақ

tired – шаршаған

use – қолдану

important – маңызды

share – бөлісу

story – оқиға

understand – түсіну
fields.grammar:
Reported Speech – Statements (жай сөйлемдер)

Direct speech
“I am tired.”
“He likes tea.”

Reported speech
She said she was tired.
He said he liked tea.

🟨 Ереже: Уақыт өткенде шақ та өзгертіледі.

am / is → was

are → were

do / does → did

will → would
fields.dialogue:
Ali: I just talked to Aigerim.
Dana: Really? What did she say?
Ali: She said she was moving to another city next month.
Dana: Wow! Did she say why?
Ali: She said she got a new job offer there.
Dana: That’s exciting! I’ll miss her.
Ali: Me too. She said she would keep in touch.

fields.title: Reported Speech — Statements (жай сөйлемдер)
fields.content:
Last weekend, we watched a movie together. After the film, I asked my friend what he thought. He said, “I didn’t like the movie. The story was boring.” Later, when someone asked me, I reported what he said: “He said he didn’t like the movie and the story was boring.”
When we change statements into reported speech, we usually change the tense one step back. If it’s in the past simple, it stays in past simple. But other tenses change.
fields.vocabulary:
movie – фильм

watch – көру

ask – сұрау

think – ойлау

boring – жалықтыратын

story – оқиға

report – баяндау

change – өзгерту

tense – шақ

past simple – жәй өткен шақ

stay – қалу

together – бірге

conversation – әңгіме

expression – сөйлем формасы

example – мысал

grammar – грамматика

mention – айту

later – кейін

film – кино

say – айту
fields.grammar:
Тікелей сөйлеу (Direct)
“I like it.”
“She is tired.”
“We watched it.”

Жанама сөйлеу (Reported)
He said he liked it.
She said she was tired.
They said they had watched it.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: Did Madi like the movie?
Aruzhan: No, he said he didn’t like it.
Aliya: Oh really? Why?
Aruzhan: He said the story was boring and too long.
Aliya: I thought it was interesting.
Aruzhan: Everyone has a different opinion!

fields.title: Reported Speech — Questions (сұрақтар)
fields.content:
When I met a tourist yesterday, he asked me, “Where are you from?” I answered, “I’m from Kazakhstan.” Later, I told my friend, “He asked me where I was from.”
When we report questions, we change the word order and tense. We do not use question marks or auxiliary verbs (do/does/did) in reported questions.
fields.vocabulary:
ask – сұрау

question – сұрақ

tourist – турист

where – қайда, қай елден

from – қайдан

answer – жауап беру

meet – кездесу

later – кейін

report – жеткізу

word order – сөз тәртібі

tense – шақ

use – қолдану

auxiliary – көмекші

verb – етістік

change – өзгерту

speak – сөйлеу

remember – есте сақтау

say – айту

mark – белгі

grammar – грамматика
fields.grammar:
Тікелей сұрақ	
“Where are you from?”
“What time is it?”
“Do you like tea?”

Жанама сұрақ
He asked me where I was from.
She asked what time it was.
He asked if I liked tea.
fields.dialogue:
Zhan: I met a tourist at the airport.
Mira: What did he ask?
Zhan: He asked where I was from.
Mira: What did you say?
Zhan: I said I was from Kazakhstan.
Mira: Did he ask anything else?
Zhan: Yes, he asked if I spoke English.

fields.title: Reported Speech — Commands and Requests (бұйрықтар мен өтініштер)
fields.content:
In the hospital waiting room, the nurse said to me, “Please sit down and wait.” Later, when I told my friend about it, I said, “The nurse told me to sit down and to wait.”
When we report commands and requests, we use “to + verb” or “not to + verb” for negative instructions.
fields.vocabulary:
command – бұйрық

request – өтініш

nurse – медбике

sit down – отыру

wait – күту

later – кейін

tell – айту

report – жеткізу

ask – сұрау

instruction – нұсқаулық

verb – етістік

form – форма

say – айту

politely – сыпайы

hospital – аурухана

patient – науқас

room – бөлме

negative – болымсыз

example – мысал

structure – құрылым
fields.grammar:
Direct
“Sit down.”
“Don’t be late.”
“Please wait here.”

Reported
He told me to sit down.
She told me not to be late.
He asked me to wait here.
fields.dialogue:
Alina: The doctor was very strict today.
Samal: What did he say?
Alina: He told me to rest and not to use my phone.
Samal: That’s serious!
Alina: He also asked me to take medicine twice a day.
Samal: You should follow his advice.

fields.title: Adverbs (үстеулер) — slowly, quickly, carefully
fields.content: My sister recently started learning to drive. At first, she was nervous, but now she drives more confidently. She carefully watches the road and always follows the rules. My father says she drives better than many experienced drivers. One time, she quickly reacted when a dog ran into the road. I was surprised. She said, “I try to stay calm and drive safely.” I’m proud of her progress.
fields.vocabulary:
carefully – мұқият

quickly – тез

slowly – баяу

confidently – сенімді түрде

nervously – қобалжып

calmly – сабырмен

safely – қауіпсіз түрде

always – әрқашан

road – жол

follow – ұстану

rule – ереже

drive – көлік жүргізу

react – әрекет ету

better – жақсырақ

than – қарағанда

proud – мақтан тұту

experience – тәжірибе

progress – даму

watch – бақылау

try – тырысу
fields.grammar:
Adverbs — етістікті сипаттайды (қалай жасалды?)

Adjective
careful
quick
slow
good

Adverb
carefully
quickly
slowly
well

She drives carefully.

He reacts quickly.

They work hard.
fields.dialogue:
Ali: Did your sister pass her driving test?
Dana: Yes! She drives very carefully now.
Ali: That’s good. Does she drive fast?
Dana: No, she usually drives slowly, but she can react quickly when needed.
Ali: Sounds like a good driver!
Dana: My dad says she drives better than him!

fields.title: Adverbs of Frequency (always, usually, sometimes, rarely, never)
fields.content: My name is Ayan, and I live a very organized life. I always wake up at 6 a.m. and do some stretching. I usually eat breakfast at 7 before going to work. During the week, I sometimes go to the gym in the evening. I rarely watch TV, because I prefer reading books. On weekends, I never wake up early — I sleep in and relax. My friends say I'm too predictable, but I like having a routine.
fields.vocabulary:
always – әрқашан

usually – әдетте

sometimes – кейде

rarely – сирек

never – ешқашан

wake up – ояну

breakfast – таңғы ас

gym – спортзал

evening – кеш

prefer – ұнату, артық көру

watch – көру

book – кітап

weekend – демалыс күндері

sleep in – ұзақ ұйықтау

relax – демалу

predictable – алдын ала белгілі

routine – күн тәртібі

organized – тәртіпті

stretch – керілу

work – жұмыс
fields.grammar:
Adverbs of Frequency — әрекеттің қаншалықты жиі болатынын көрсететін үстеулер.

Мысалдар:

– I always brush my teeth before bed.
– She usually goes to school by bus.
– We sometimes eat out on Fridays.
– He rarely plays video games.
– They never smoke.

Бұл үстеулер Present Simple шақта жиі қолданылады және етістік алдында немесе to be етістігінен кейін қойылады.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: What do you usually do in the morning?
Ayan: I always wake up early and do stretching.
Aliya: Do you ever watch TV?
Ayan: Not really. I rarely watch TV. I prefer reading.
Aliya: And on weekends?
Ayan: I never wake up early on weekends. I relax and sleep in.
Aliya: Sounds peaceful!

fields.title: Adverbs of Manner — әрекеттің сипатын көрсету
fields.content: At the interview yesterday, I was very nervous. The interviewer spoke clearly and asked questions slowly, which helped me understand. I tried to speak confidently, even though I felt stressed. I smiled and answered every question politely. After the interview, the manager said I behaved professionally. He shook my hand firmly and said they would contact me soon. I think I did well.
fields.vocabulary:
politely – сыпайы түрде

clearly – анық

slowly – баяу

confidently – сенімді түрде

professionally – кәсіби түрде

nervously – қобалжып

firmly – нық

interview – сұхбат

manager – басшы

contact – хабарласу

behave – өзін ұстау

shake hands – қол алысу

question – сұрақ

answer – жауап

smile – күлімдеу

speak – сөйлеу

understand – түсіну

stress – күйзеліс

soon – жақында

yesterday – кеше
fields.grammar:
Adverbs of manner — әрекеттің қалай жасалғанын көрсетеді. Олар әдетте етістіктен кейін тұрады.

Мысалдар:

– She sings beautifully.
– He works hard.
– They listen carefully.
– I answered politely during the interview.

Егер сын есім “careful” болса, үстеу “carefully” болады.
fields.dialogue:
Marat: How was your interview?
Anara: I think it went well. I tried to answer all questions politely.
Marat: Did they ask anything difficult?
Anara: Yes, but they spoke slowly and clearly. That helped.
Marat: You always speak confidently.
Anara: Thanks! I behaved professionally and smiled a lot.

fields.title: Үстеулер арқылы әрекеттерді нақтылау
fields.content:
Today during class, a girl suddenly stood up and quickly ran out of the room. Everyone looked surprised. The teacher calmly said, “Let’s continue.” After ten minutes, the girl came back and quietly sat down. She whispered, “Sorry, I wasn’t feeling well.”
After class, I asked her if she was okay. She smiled weakly and said she was better now. I noticed she walked slowly and seemed tired. I hope she gets better soon.
fields.vocabulary:
suddenly – кенеттен

quickly – тез

quietly – тыныш

calmly – сабырмен

weakly – әлсіз түрде

slowly – баяу

whisper – сыбырлау

feel – сезіну

tired – шаршаған

run – жүгіріп шығу

stand up – орнынан тұру

come back – қайта оралу

continue – жалғастыру

notice – байқау

get better – жақсару

seem – көріну

class – сабақ

teacher – мұғалім

student – оқушы

surprised – таң қалған
fields.grammar:
Үстеулер әрекетті нақтылайды. Олар көбіне етістіктен кейін келеді.

Мысалдар:

– He entered quietly.
– She smiled nervously.
– They reacted quickly.
– The teacher spoke calmly.

Кейде үстеулер сөйлемнің басында да тұра алады:
– Suddenly, the lights went off.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: What happened in class today?
Madina: Didn’t you see? A girl ran out of the room so quickly.
Aliya: Yes! That was strange.
Madina: She came back later and sat down very quietly.
Aliya: I hope she’s okay.
Madina: She said she wasn’t feeling well. She walked really slowly.

fields.title: Қайталау сабағы — Reported Speech
fields.content:
Last week, our teacher asked us to report five things we heard during the day. I remembered that my friend Aina said, “I forgot to do my homework.” I told the teacher: “Aina said she had forgotten to do her homework.”
Another student reported: “My dad said he was working late.”
We also practiced reporting questions: “Where is the book?” → He asked where the book was.
And commands: “Close the door.” → She told me to close the door.
fields.vocabulary:
report – баяндау

forget – ұмыту

homework – үй тапсырмасы

ask – сұрау

command – бұйрық

question – сұрақ

say – айту

told – айтты

answer – жауап

remember – есте сақтау

class – сынып

late – кеш

door – есік

close – жабу

teacher – мұғалім
fields.grammar:
Reported Speech – өткенде айтылған ойларды, сұрақтарды, бұйрықтарды қайта айту үшін қолданылады.

– “I am tired.” → He said he was tired.
– “Do you like tea?” → She asked if I liked tea.
– “Please wait.” → He asked me to wait.
– “Don’t go.” → She told me not to go.
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: Did you report five things like I asked?
Dias: Yes! My mom said she was cooking dinner.
Teacher: Good. Did anyone report a question?
Dias: Yes, Ali asked where his book was.
Teacher: And a command?
Dias: My sister told me to clean my room.

fields.title: Қайталау сабағы — Adverbs
fields.content:
My brother is a surgeon. He always works carefully and follows safety rules. During operations, he moves slowly and speaks quietly. Patients say he explains things clearly and answers questions politely. He rarely takes breaks but still looks calm and happy.
When I asked him why, he said, “If you work confidently, your patients will trust you.” I admire his dedication and hope to be like him someday.
fields.vocabulary:
surgeon – хирург

operation – операция

safety – қауіпсіздік

move – қозғалу

patient – науқас

explain – түсіндіру

break – үзіліс

calm – сабырлы

admire – таңдану

dedication – адалдық, еңбекқорлық

trust – сенім

confidently – сенімді түрде

always – әрқашан

rarely – сирек

carefully – мұқият

clearly – анық

quietly – тыныш

happily – қуанышпен

someday – бір күні

hope – үміттену
fields.grammar:
Adverbs сөйлемде әрекетті сипаттау үшін қолданылады:

– She sings beautifully.
– He drives carefully.
– I always do my homework.
– They rarely go out.

Adverbs of manner (carefully, confidently), frequency (always, never), time (yesterday, soon) – бәрі әрекетке нақты мағына береді.
fields.dialogue:
Aigerim: Your brother is a surgeon, right?
Murat: Yes. He always works carefully and calmly.
Aigerim: That’s impressive.
Murat: He rarely takes breaks, but he still stays focused.
Aigerim: Does he get tired?
Murat: Of course, but he says if you work confidently, people trust you.

fields.title: Герундий (Gerund) — кіріспе және негізгі қолданылуы
fields.content: Amina loves learning languages. Every day, she spends time reading, writing, and listening to English podcasts. She says that practicing every day helps her improve. She also enjoys traveling and meeting new people. For her, learning is not just a hobby — it’s a way of life. She believes that trying new things makes life more exciting. She told me, “I avoid wasting time and focus on doing something useful.”
fields.vocabulary:
enjoy – ұнату

love – жақсы көру

spend time – уақыт өткізу

reading – оқу

writing – жазу

listening – тыңдау

practicing – жаттығу жасау

traveling – саяхаттау

meeting – кездесу

learning – үйрену

avoid – аулақ болу

wasting – босқа өткізу

focus on – назар аудару

doing – жасау

way of life – өмір салты

believe – сену

improve – жетілдіру

hobby – хобби

exciting – қызықты

useful – пайдалы
fields.grammar:
Gerund – етістікке -ing жалғауы жалғанып, зат есім ретінде қолданылады.

Кейбір етістіктерден кейін gerund қолданылады:
– enjoy, love, like, hate, mind, finish, avoid, suggest, keep, spend time

Мысалдар:
– I enjoy reading.
– She avoids driving at night.
– They finished cleaning the house.
fields.dialogue:
Dias: What do you do in your free time?
Amina: I love reading and listening to podcasts.
Dias: That’s great. I enjoy writing stories.
Amina: Nice! I also spend time practicing English every morning.
Dias: Sounds like you’re very dedicated.
Amina: I try avoiding wasting time.

fields.title: Infinitive
fields.content: Last month, I decided to take an online course in graphic design. I wanted to learn something new and useful. My goal was to improve my digital skills. Every evening, I try to study for at least one hour. It’s not always easy, but I plan to continue learning. My friend also promised to help me with practice tasks. Learning online requires motivation and discipline, but I’m happy to challenge myself.
fields.vocabulary:
decide – шешім қабылдау

start – бастау

take a course – курсқа қатысу

want – қалау

plan – жоспарлау

promise – уәде беру

try – тырысу

learn – үйрену

improve – жетілдіру

continue – жалғастыру

challenge – сынау

require – талап ету

motivation – мотивация

discipline – тәртіп

happy – қуанышты

hour – сағат

skill – дағды

digital – сандық

useful – пайдалы

evening – кеш
fields.grammar:
To + verb формасы – infinitive деп аталады.

Кейбір етістіктерден кейін infinitive қолданылады:
– want, decide, need, plan, promise, hope, try, learn, agree, refuse

Мысалдар:
– I decided to study.
– She promised to help me.
– They want to travel next year.
fields.dialogue:
Madi: I want to start a new course.
Aruzhan: What do you plan to study?
Madi: I’ve decided to learn graphic design.
Aruzhan: That’s cool! Are you going to study online?
Madi: Yes. I hope to finish it in two months.
Aruzhan: Good luck! Let me know if you need help.

fields.title: Герундий мен инфинитив айырмашылықтары (like doing / like to do)
fields.content:
Some verbs can be followed by both the gerund and the infinitive, but the meaning might change slightly. For example, I like to run in the park — it’s part of my routine. But I also say, “I love running in the early morning,” because I enjoy the feeling.
My sister prefers to walk to work, while my friend prefers walking because she listens to music. Some people hate waiting, while others don’t mind to wait if they are not in a rush.
fields.vocabulary:
like – ұнату

love – жақсы көру

prefer – артық көру

hate – жек көру

mind – қарсы болу

wait – күту

walk – жүру

run – жүгіру

routine – күн тәртібі

early – ерте

in a rush – асығыс

enjoy – рахат алу

morning – таң

feel – сезіну

music – музыка

slowly – баяу

sometimes – кейде

change – өзгерту

verb – етістік

form – форма
fields.grammar:
Кейбір етістіктерден кейін gerund те, infinitive те қолдануға болады:

– I like reading.
– I like to read.
Екеуі де дұрыс, бірақ:
– “I like to read” — әдетті білдіреді.
– “I like reading” — сол әрекеттен рахат алу сезімін білдіреді.

Басқа мысалдар:
– I love cooking.
– I love to cook.
– She prefers to drive.
– She prefers driving.
fields.dialogue:
Timur: Do you like cooking?
Ainura: Yes, I love cooking when I have time.
Timur: I like to cook in the evenings.
Ainura: I prefer cooking in the morning — it's peaceful.
Timur: My brother hates waiting for food!
Ainura: I don’t mind waiting if the food is good.

fields.title: Relative Clauses (who, which, that)
fields.content:
There are people who change our lives. For me, it was my English teacher who always encouraged me. A teacher is someone who explains things clearly and supports students. I also remember a book that helped me understand myself better. It was about a girl who moved to another country. The house which they lived in was small, but full of love.
Relative clauses help us give more information about people or things without starting a new sentence.
fields.vocabulary:
teacher – мұғалім

inspire – шабыт беру

encourage – жігерлендіру

explain – түсіндіру

support – қолдау

remember – есте сақтау

book – кітап

move – көшу

country – ел

live – өмір сүру

small – кішкентай

full of – толы

love – махаббат

someone – біреу

house – үй

student – оқушы

understand – түсіну

better – жақсырақ

help – көмектесу

information – ақпарат
fields.grammar:
Relative Clauses — сөйлемге қосымша ақпарат береді. Екі негізгі түрі бар:

who – адам туралы

which / that – зат немесе жануар туралы

Мысалдар:
– The man who lives next door is a doctor.
– The book that you gave me was interesting.
– The car which she bought is expensive.
fields.dialogue:
Aruzhan: Who’s that woman?
Madi: She’s the teacher who helped me last year.
Aruzhan: And what’s that book?
Madi: That’s the one that changed my life.
Aruzhan: I love stories which teach life lessons.

fields.title: Relative Clauses (who)
fields.content: Last week, we read a news article about a man who saved a dog from a frozen river. He is a firefighter who works in the city. People admire heroes — especially those who risk their lives for others. I know a volunteer who teaches English to children in rural areas. My cousin is a doctor who helps patients in remote villages. These are the kinds of people who make the world better.
fields.vocabulary:
man – ер адам

save – құтқару

dog – ит

frozen – мұздаған

river – өзен

firefighter – өрт сөндіруші

city – қала

admire – таңдану

hero – қаһарман

risk – тәуекел ету

life – өмір

volunteer – ерікті

teach – үйрету

child – бала

rural – ауылдық

doctor – дәрігер

patient – науқас

remote – шалғай

village – ауыл

world – әлем
fields.grammar:
Who – адамдар туралы қосымша ақпарат бергенде қолданылады.

Мысалдар:
– The woman who lives next door is kind.
– He is the man who won the competition.
– They help people who need support.

“Who” арқылы екі сөйлемді біріктіруге болады.
fields.dialogue:
Dana: Did you hear about the man who saved the dog?
Ali: Yes! He’s a firefighter who works in our city.
Dana: I admire people who help others.
Ali: Me too. My aunt is a doctor who works in remote places.

fields.title: Relative Clauses — заттар мен жануарлар туралы айту (which, that)
fields.content: I recently bought a book that explains how the brain works. It’s one of the best books which I’ve ever read. The pictures which are included help make the topic easier to understand. I also have a cat that likes watching birds through the window. Last night, it knocked over a lamp which was very expensive. I still love my cat, but I need to keep breakable things away from it now.
fields.vocabulary:
book – кітап

buy – сатып алу

explain – түсіндіру

brain – ми

work – жұмыс істеу

picture – сурет

include – қосу

topic – тақырып

understand – түсіну

cat – мысық

bird – құс

watch – қарау

knock over – құлату

lamp – шам

expensive – қымбат

love – жақсы көру

breakable – сынғыш

thing – зат

away – алыста

keep – сақтау
fields.grammar:
Which және that — жануарлар мен заттар туралы қосымша ақпарат беру үшін қолданылады. Екеуі де дұрыс, бірақ:

– That – сөйлеу тілінде жиі қолданылады.
– Which – ресми немесе жазбаша стильде қолданылады.

Мысалдар:
– The phone that I lost was new.
– The dog which barked all night lives next door.
– This is the movie that made me cry.
fields.dialogue:
Aruzhan: What are you reading?
Madi: A book that explains how the human brain works.
Aruzhan: Sounds interesting.
Madi: Yes, it has illustrations which make it easier to understand.
Aruzhan: I love books that teach something useful.

fields.title: Relative Clauses қолданумен сөйлемдерді біріктіру
fields.content:
Yesterday, I met a woman. She writes for a famous travel magazine. → I met a woman who writes for a famous travel magazine.
She showed me photos. They were taken in Africa. → She showed me photos which were taken in Africa.
We visited a museum. It was built in 1920. → We visited a museum that was built in 1920.

Joining sentences using relative clauses helps you speak and write more fluently. It makes your ideas clearer and your grammar stronger.
fields.vocabulary:
meet – кездесу

woman – әйел

write – жазу

magazine – журнал

famous – танымал

photo – сурет

take – түсіру

Africa – Африка

visit – бару

museum – мұражай

build – салу

join – біріктіру

sentence – сөйлем

fluently – еркін

idea – ой

grammar – грамматика

stronger – күшті

show – көрсету

clear – анық

speak – сөйлеу
fields.grammar:
Екі қарапайым сөйлемді who, which, that арқылы байланыстыруға болады:

– I met a girl. She speaks French.
→ I met a girl who speaks French.

– I saw a film. It was boring.
→ I saw a film that was boring.

Бұл тәсіл сөйлеу мен жазуда мазмұнды байытады.
fields.dialogue:
Alina: I visited a village yesterday.
Dias: Really? What was special about it?
Alina: I met a man who makes instruments by hand.
Dias: That’s amazing!
Alina: He showed me a drum which he made last year.

fields.title: Complex Sentences
fields.content: Last weekend, we had planned to go hiking. Although the weather forecast said it would rain, we still went. Because we had raincoats and boots, we weren’t worried. We walked in the forest for two hours. While we were walking, we saw deer and birds. After we got home, we drank tea and talked about the trip. I felt happy even though I was tired. It was a great day!
fields.vocabulary:
although – дегенмен

because – себебі

while – кезінде

after – кейін

even though – тіпті

rain – жаңбыр

hiking – жаяу серуен

raincoat – жаңбыр жамылғысы

boot – етік

worry – уайымдау

forest – орман

deer – бұғы

bird – құс

tea – шай

trip – саяхат

plan – жоспарлау

walk – жүру

get home – үйге жету

feel – сезіну

great – керемет
fields.grammar:
Күрделі сөйлемдер — екі не одан көп сөйлемді байланыстырушы сөздермен (conjunctions) байланыстырады.

Мысалдар:

– Although it was cold, we went outside.
– I didn’t go to work because I was sick.
– While she was cooking, I cleaned the house.
– We rested after we finished.

Бұл сөйлемдер екі әрекетті немесе жағдайды біріктіреді және сөйлеуді табиғи етеді.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: I heard you went hiking on Saturday.
Nursultan: Yes, although it was raining, we still went.
Aliya: Really? That’s brave!
Nursultan: We weren’t worried because we had good gear.
Aliya: What did you see?
Nursultan: While we were walking, we saw a deer.

fields.title: Gerund және Infinitive
fields.content: I love playing musical instruments. A month ago, I started learning the guitar. At first, it was hard, but I kept practicing. My teacher advised me to practice every day and to listen to music carefully. I enjoy learning new songs. I plan to take a performance class next month. For me, to learn music is both fun and relaxing.
fields.vocabulary:
start – бастау

learn – үйрену

advise – кеңес беру

practice – жаттығу

play – ойнау

guitar – гитара

listen – тыңдау

song – ән

take a class – курсқа қатысу

performance – өнер көрсету

relaxing – босаңсытатын

fun – қызықты

hard – қиын

carefully – мұқият

enjoy – ұнату
fields.grammar:
Gerund – enjoy, love, start, keep, finish, avoid сияқты етістіктерден кейін қолданылады.
Infinitive – want, plan, hope, decide, need сияқты етістіктерден кейін келеді.

Мысалдар:
– I enjoy learning music.
– I decided to take a new course.
– I started playing the guitar.
fields.dialogue:
Aigerim: You play guitar really well.
Dias: Thanks! I started learning last month.
Aigerim: That’s impressive.
Dias: I practice every day. My teacher told me to listen carefully.
Aigerim: I’m thinking of learning too!

fields.title: Relative Clauses
fields.content: I’ll never forget the people who helped me during my trip to Turkey. I lost my bag, and a woman who spoke English came to help. She introduced me to a police officer who found my bag. I also visited a museum which had ancient artifacts. The hotel that I stayed in was near the sea. I met a family who invited me to dinner. These are memories that I will always remember.
fields.vocabulary:
help – көмектесу

trip – саяхат

lose – жоғалту

introduce – таныстыру

police officer – полиция қызметкері

find – табу

museum – мұражай

ancient – көне

artifact – жәдігер

hotel – қонақ үй

stay – тұру

sea – теңіз

family – отбасы

invite – шақыру

dinner – кешкі ас

memory – естелік

forget – ұмыту

speak – сөйлеу

amazing – керемет

remember – есте сақтау
fields.grammar:
Who – адамдар үшін
Which – заттар үшін
That – адамдарға да, заттарға да қолданылады

Мысалдар:
– The teacher who helped me was kind.
– The house which we rented was big.
– The song that I love is old.
fields.dialogue:
Mira: How was your trip to Turkey?
Arman: Amazing! I met a woman who helped me find my lost bag.
Mira: That’s lucky!
Arman: I stayed in a hotel that was right by the sea.
Mira: Sounds like a trip which you’ll never forget.

fields.title: Expressing Feelings
fields.content: Before my first presentation, I felt many emotions. I was nervous because I didn’t want to make mistakes. At the same time, I was excited because I wanted to share my ideas. As I walked into the room, my hands were shaking. But when I started speaking, I felt more confident. After the presentation, people clapped, and I was very happy and relieved. That experience made me stronger and taught me to face my fears.
fields.vocabulary:
nervous – қобалжулы

excited – қуанышты (толқулы)

presentation – презентация

mistake – қате

shake – дірілдеу

confident – сенімді

clap – қол соғу

relieved – жеңілдеген

experience – тәжірибе

fear – қорқыныш

emotion – сезім

strong – күшті

face – қарсы тұру

share – бөлісу

idea – ой

happy – бақытты

room – бөлме

speak – сөйлеу

grow – өсу

make (a mistake) – қате жіберу
fields.grammar:
Сезімдерді білдіру үшін мына құрылымдар қолданылады:

– I felt nervous before the test.
– She was excited to travel.
– He is always confident during interviews.
– We were relieved when it was over.

Кейде feel + adjective, кейде be + adjective қолданылады.
fields.dialogue:
Aruzhan: How did you feel before your presentation?
Dias: Honestly, I felt nervous, but also excited.
Aruzhan: Were you confident while speaking?
Dias: Yes. Once I started, I felt calm and focused.
Aruzhan: That’s great!
Dias: I was so happy when people clapped at the end.

fields.title: Expressing Opinions
fields.content: Some people think watching TV is relaxing. But in my opinion, reading books is more useful. Books make us imagine, think deeper, and understand others better. I believe that reading helps us improve our vocabulary and focus. Of course, watching movies is fun too, but I prefer reading before bed. It’s quiet and peaceful. Everyone has different opinions, and we should respect them.
fields.vocabulary:
opinion – пікір

in my opinion – менің ойымша

believe – сену

think – ойлау

useful – пайдалы

imagine – елестету

understand – түсіну

others – басқалар

improve – жақсарту

vocabulary – сөздік қор

focus – назар аудару

prefer – артық көру

peaceful – тыныш

quiet – тыныштық

different – әртүрлі

respect – құрметтеу

compare – салыстыру

activity – әрекет

learn – үйрену

relaxing – демалуға арналған
fields.grammar:
Ой білдіруде қолданылатын тіркестер:

– In my opinion, reading is better.
– I think it’s important to study every day.
– I believe this movie is overrated.
– From my point of view, this decision was wrong.
fields.dialogue:
Madi: Do you prefer books or movies?
Aliya: Honestly, I prefer books. In my opinion, they help us think more.
Madi: I see. I believe movies are more emotional.
Aliya: That’s true. But reading helps me relax.
Madi: Everyone has different opinions, and that’s okay.

fields.title: Agreement/disagreement
fields.content:
During group discussions, it’s normal to have different views. Last week, our team discussed social media. One classmate said, “Social media is harmful.” I replied, “I see your point, but I don’t fully agree.” I think social media can be harmful, but it also connects people. Another student said, “I totally agree with you.”
When expressing disagreement, it’s important to stay respectful and polite.
fields.vocabulary:
agree – келісу

disagree – келіспеу

point – ой, пікір

see your point – ойыңды түсіндім

fully – толық

harmful – зиянды

connect – байланыстыру

social media – әлеуметтік желі

respectful – сыйластықпен

polite – сыпайы

discussion – пікірталас

opinion – пікір

reply – жауап беру

say – айту

totally – толығымен

team – команда

view – көзқарас

normal – қалыпты

important – маңызды

feel – сезіну
fields.grammar:
Келісу және келіспеу фразалары:

Келісу:
– I agree with you.
– That’s true.
– I think the same.
– Absolutely!

Келіспеу:
– I don’t agree.
– I’m not sure about that.
– I see your point, but...
– I have a different opinion.
fields.dialogue:
Zhanar: I think exams are stressful and useless.
Dias: I see your point, but I don’t fully agree.
Zhanar: Why not?
Dias: Exams help us stay focused.
Zhanar: Hmm. I guess that’s true.
Dias: But I agree they shouldn’t be too difficult.

fields.title: Фильмдер туралы әңгімелеу және сын-пікір айту
fields.content:
Last night, I watched a film called “The Last Letter.” It was about a soldier and his family. The story was emotional and the acting was excellent. I especially liked the music and the visuals. The ending was a bit sad, but powerful.
In my opinion, it’s one of the best war dramas I’ve ever seen. Some scenes were slow, but overall, I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys serious films.
fields.vocabulary:
movie – фильм

emotional – әсерлі

acting – актерлік ойын

excellent – өте жақсы

especially – әсіресе

visual – көрініс

ending – аяқталуы

powerful – әсерлі

drama – драма

scene – көрініс

recommend – ұсыну

enjoy – ұнату

watch – көру

war – соғыс

family – отбасы

slow – баяу

story – оқиға

music – музыка

sad – қайғылы

overall – жалпы
fields.grammar:
Сын-пікір айтуда жиі қолданылатын тіркестер:

– I thought the movie was brilliant.
– The story was well-written.
– The acting was amazing.
– I didn’t enjoy the ending.
– Some scenes were boring.
fields.dialogue:
Aruzhan: Did you like the movie?
Madi: Yes, it was emotional and well-acted.
Aruzhan: What didn’t you like?
Madi: Some scenes were slow, but overall it was great.
Aruzhan: Would you recommend it?
Madi: Absolutely!

fields.title: Әдеби шығармалар туралы пікір білдіру
fields.content:
Recently, I finished a novel called “The Silent Voice.” It’s about a teenager who can’t speak but expresses himself through music. The book was beautifully written. The characters were deep, and the emotions felt real.
I believe the author did a great job showing the power of communication without words. This novel made me think about people with disabilities and how they face challenges every day. I highly recommend this book to those who enjoy emotional and meaningful stories.
fields.vocabulary:

teenager – жасөспірім

express – білдіру

character – кейіпкер

emotion – сезім

author – автор

challenge – қиындық

communication – қарым-қатынас

disability – мүмкіндігі шектеулі

recommend – ұсыну

real – шынайы

beautiful – әдемі

write – жазу

finish – аяқтау

believe – сену

think – ойлау

face – тап болу
fields.grammar:
Кітап туралы пікір білдіру үлгілері:

– The book was beautifully written.
– The story touched my heart.
– I enjoyed the author’s style.
– It made me think deeply.
– I would recommend this book.
fields.dialogue:
Zhan: Have you read “The Silent Voice”?
Aliya: Yes! It made me cry.
Zhan: The story was so touching.
Aliya: I loved how the author showed emotion without words.
Zhan: I’d recommend it to anyone.

fields.title: Discussing music preferences
fields.content:
Music is a big part of my life. I usually listen to music while working or walking. I enjoy different styles, but I mostly prefer pop and indie music. I love songs with meaningful lyrics and strong melodies.
My favorite singer is Adele. Her voice is powerful and emotional. I also like traditional Kazakh music — it’s calm and spiritual. I believe music connects people across cultures and helps express emotions when words are not enough.
fields.vocabulary:
music – музыка

listen – тыңдау

style – стиль

prefer – артық көру

pop – поп музыка

indie – инди музыка

lyrics – ән мәтіні

melody – әуен

powerful – әсерлі

emotional – эмоциялы

calm – тыныш

spiritual – рухани

traditional – дәстүрлі

singer – әнші

voice – дауыс

express – білдіру

culture – мәдениет

connect – байланыстыру

enough – жеткілікті

every day – күн сайын
fields.grammar:
Музыка туралы сөйлеу үшін жиі қолданылатын құрылымдар:

– I enjoy listening to...
– I prefer songs with...
– Her voice is...
– This music helps me relax.
fields.dialogue:
Zarina: What kind of music do you listen to?
Ayan: Mostly pop and indie. You?
Zarina: I prefer traditional Kazakh music. It helps me relax.
Ayan: Do you have a favorite singer?
Zarina: Yes, I love Dimash. His voice is incredible.

fields.title: Comparing different genres
fields.content:
I enjoy listening to both classical music and hip-hop, though they are very different. Classical music is calm, slow, and emotional. It helps me concentrate while studying. In contrast, hip-hop is fast, energetic, and full of rhythm.
Each genre has its beauty. Classical music is often played by orchestras, while hip-hop usually features beats and rap. I think it’s great that people have different tastes — music offers something for everyone.
fields.vocabulary:

genre – жанр

hip-hop – хип-хоп

everyone – әркімге арналған
fields.grammar:
Жанрларды салыстырғанда мына сөздер қолданылады:

– Classical music is calmer than hip-hop.
– Hip-hop is more energetic than jazz.
– I think rock is better for running.
fields.dialogue:
Miras: What do you think about classical music?
Aigerim: It’s beautiful. I listen to it while studying.
Miras: I prefer hip-hop — it’s more energetic.
Aigerim: That’s true. I listen to it at the gym.
Miras: Different genres for different moods!

fields.title: Writing about culture
fields.content:
Kazakhstan has a rich cultural history. Our traditions, such as hospitality, respect for elders, and celebrating Nauryz, are still strong today. One tradition I love is “Besik toý” — a celebration for a newborn baby.
In my opinion, culture is not just food, clothes, or language. It’s how people live, think, and connect. Learning about other cultures helps us understand the world better. In this essay, I want to explain why we must preserve and share our culture with future generations.
fields.vocabulary:

hospitality – қонақжайлылық

respect – құрмет

celebration – тойлау

newborn – жаңа туған

live – өмір сүру

think – ойлау

connect – байланыс орнату

food – тағам

clothes – киім

language – тіл

history – тарих

essay – эссе

explain – түсіндіру

preserve – сақтау

share – бөлісу

future – болашақ

generation – ұрпақ
fields.grammar:
Эссе жазғанда қолданылатын тіркестер:

– In my opinion, culture is...
– One tradition I love is...
– It is important to preserve...
– This shows that...
– I believe that...
fields.dialogue:
Amina: What are you writing about?
Rustam: An essay on Kazakh culture.
Amina: That’s nice! Which tradition did you choose?
Rustam: “Besik toý”. It’s full of meaning.
Amina: I love that one too.

fields.title: Expressing opinions and feelings
fields.content:
During a class debate, we talked about social behavior. I said, “I believe in kindness and helping others.” Some classmates agreed, while others thought people should be more practical. I respected their views, but I explained how small acts of kindness change lives.
When someone listens to you or gives a compliment, it can make your day better. Expressing positive emotions and sharing opinions respectfully builds a strong community.
fields.vocabulary:
kindness – мейірімділік

debate – пікірталас

agree – келісу

practical – шынайы, тәжірибелік

respect – құрмет

act – әрекет

compliment – мақтау

emotion – сезім

build – құру

share – бөлісу

express – білдіру

believe – сену

change – өзгерту

fields.grammar:
– I believe that kindness matters.
– In my opinion, we should support each other.
– I feel happy when I help others.
– She said she was proud of our group.
fields.dialogue:
Mira: Do you think kindness matters?
Adil: Absolutely. I believe small things can make a big difference.
Mira: I agree. A smile or kind word helps.
Adil: It also builds trust and friendship.

fields.title: Films, Music, Literature
fields.content:
This month, we learned how art — through movies, music, and books — influences our lives. A good film can make us think. A beautiful song can heal our hearts. A powerful book can inspire action.
I used to watch movies just for fun. Now, I try to find deeper meaning. I listen to lyrics and notice how characters change. I realized that every story teaches us something if we pay attention.
fields.vocabulary:
art – өнер

influence – әсер ету

heart – жүрек

powerful – әсерлі

inspire – шабыттандыру

action – әрекет

deeper – тереңірек

fields.grammar:
– A book can change how we think.
– I used to watch movies only for fun.
– Now I try to find meaning.
– Music helps me feel better.
fields.dialogue:
Zhanar: Do you prefer movies or books?
Aliya: Both. Movies show emotion, but books go deeper.
Zhanar: That’s true. I often feel more from music.
Aliya: Yes, art makes life richer.

fields.title: Science and technology
fields.content:
Science and technology have changed the way we live. From smartphones to space travel, the progress is amazing. Today, we can study online, work remotely, and even use artificial intelligence to solve problems. Scientists have created robots that help in hospitals and factories.
Thanks to technology, communication is faster and easier. However, we must use it wisely. Technology should help us live better, not control our lives.
fields.vocabulary:

technology – технология

change – өзгерту

progress – ілгерілеу

fields.grammar:
Технология туралы сөйлеу үшін Present Perfect және Passive Voice жиі қолданылады:

– Scientists have developed new tools.
– Robots are used in modern hospitals.
– Technology has changed our daily lives.
fields.dialogue:
Aliya: Do you think technology makes life easier?
Madi: Yes. We can now work from home and study online.
Aliya: Have you used AI before?
Madi: Yes, I used a chatbot to practice English.
Aliya: That’s so cool!

fields.title: Pros and cons of modern technology
fields.content:
Modern technology helps us do things faster and more efficiently. We can communicate instantly, find information quickly, and automate difficult tasks. But it also has disadvantages. People spend too much time on screens, become addicted to social media, and sometimes lose real-life connections.
In my opinion, the key is balance. We should enjoy the benefits of technology but also remember to disconnect sometimes.
fields.vocabulary:

benefit – пайда

drawback – кемшілік

screen – экран

social media – әлеуметтік желі

automate – автоматтандыру

connection – байланыс

enjoy – рахаттану

disconnect – ажырау

fast – тез

opinion – пікір

fields.grammar:
Артықшылықтар мен кемшіліктерді айтуда:

– One advantage of technology is…
– One disadvantage is that…
– I believe the benefits outweigh the drawbacks.
– We need to find a balance.
fields.dialogue:
Dias: Do you think technology is always good?
Alua: Not really. It has benefits and drawbacks.
Dias: Like what?
Alua: It helps with work, but people become addicted to phones.
Dias: True. Balance is important.

fields.title: Importance of sports
fields.content:
Sports play a vital role in society. They improve our health, build teamwork, and teach discipline. In schools, sports help students stay active and develop confidence. National sports events unite people and create a feeling of pride.
Many believe that sports also reduce stress and improve mental health. Whether you play or watch, sports inspire people and bring joy to millions.
fields.vocabulary:

inspire – шабыттандыру

role – рөл

improve – жақсарту

build – қалыптастыру

unite – біріктіру
fields.grammar:
Спорттың пайдасын сипаттағанда:

– Sports help us stay healthy.
– They teach discipline and teamwork.
– National teams bring people together.
fields.dialogue:
Miras: Do you play any sports?
Ainur: Yes, I play volleyball. It helps me stay active.
Miras: I just watch football.
Ainur: That’s okay too! Sports bring people together.

fields.title: Popular sports and games
fields.content:
Across the globe, people love different sports. Football is the most watched sport in the world. In the US, basketball and American football are very popular. In Japan, sumo wrestling is a traditional favorite.
In Kazakhstan, people enjoy football, wrestling, and national sports like kokpar. Sports reflect the culture and history of a country. Watching or playing sports helps people connect and stay healthy.

wrestling – күрес

play – ойнау

stay – қалу
fields.grammar:
Салыстырмалы құрылымдар:

– Football is more popular than tennis.
– Sumo is the most traditional sport in Japan.
– Kokpar is a sport that reflects Kazakh culture.
fields.dialogue:
Bota: What’s your favorite sport?
Nurlan: I love football. It’s exciting and popular.
Bota: Have you watched kokpar?
Nurlan: Yes! It really shows our national spirit.

fields.title: Basics of money and economy
fields.content:
Money is a part of our daily lives. We use it to buy food, pay for services, and save for the future. A good economy provides jobs, supports businesses, and keeps prices stable.
Key concepts in economics include inflation, income, taxes, and budgeting. Learning about money helps us make better decisions and plan for our goals. In school, financial education is just as important as math or science.
fields.vocabulary:
money – ақша

economy – экономика

income – табыс

fields.grammar:
Экономика туралы айтқанда:

– We spend money on food and clothes.
– A strong economy creates jobs.
– Learning about money helps us plan.
fields.dialogue:
Zhanar: Do you think financial education is important?
Ali: Definitely. We all use money every day.
Zhanar: I’ve started learning how to budget.
Ali: That’s great. It helps save for the future.

fields.title: Қазіргі заман экономикасы туралы сөйлесу
fields.content:
In today’s world, the economy is connected across countries. What happens in one country can affect others. For example, oil prices can change the cost of goods everywhere. Technology is also changing how people work and earn money. Many people now earn income from online jobs or freelancing.
Governments try to manage inflation, unemployment, and national debt. Economic problems like poverty and inequality are still big challenges. We must stay informed and learn how the economy works.
fields.vocabulary:
global – жаһандық

economy – экономика

connected – байланысты

affect – әсер ету

price – баға

goods – тауарлар

technology – технология

earn – табу

informed – хабардар
fields.grammar:
Present Simple + Passive Voice:

– Jobs are being created in the tech industry.
– Poverty remains a serious issue.
fields.dialogue:
Zarina: Why are prices going up?
Dias: It’s because of inflation and oil prices.
Zarina: Do you think freelancing is a good option?
Dias: Yes, many people now earn income online.
Zarina: That’s true. The economy is changing fast.

fields.title: Денсаулық сақтау жүйесі — кіріспе және негізгі терминдер
fields.content:
Every person deserves access to quality healthcare. A good healthcare system includes hospitals, clinics, doctors, and nurses. It also provides medicine and emergency services. In some countries, healthcare is free. In others, people pay insurance or private fees.
Governments invest in healthcare to protect the population. Preventive care, such as vaccines and regular check-ups, helps reduce serious illnesses. A strong system can improve life expectancy and overall well-being.
fields.vocabulary:

clinic – емхана

life expectancy – өмір ұзақтығы
fields.grammar:
Healthcare туралы сөйлеуде:

– Everyone deserves healthcare.
– Some countries provide free services.
– Regular check-ups help prevent illness.
fields.dialogue:
Nurlan: Is healthcare free in your country?
Aigerim: Yes, basic services are free, but some medicine is not.
Nurlan: I think preventive care is very important.
Aigerim: I agree. Vaccines and check-ups save lives.

fields.title: Дәрігермен сөйлесу және медициналық сөздік
fields.content:
Last week, I felt unwell. I had a headache, fever, and sore throat. I went to the clinic and saw a doctor. She asked, “What symptoms do you have?” I said, “I feel weak and tired.” She checked my temperature and said I had a mild infection.
She gave me medicine and told me to rest and drink fluids. After a few days, I felt better. It’s important to describe symptoms clearly when visiting a doctor.
fields.vocabulary:
fever – қызу

sore throat – тамақ ауруы

headache – бас ауруы

clinic – емхана

symptom – симптом

infection – инфекция

medicine – дәрі

tired – шаршаған

weak – әлсіз

check – тексеру

give – беру

describe – сипаттау

visit – бару

unwell – ауырып тұрған

mild – жеңіл

important – маңызды
fields.grammar:
Past Simple + Medical verbs:

– I had a fever.
– The doctor gave me medicine.
– I felt better after three days.
fields.dialogue:
Doctor: What symptoms do you have?
Patient: I have a sore throat and a headache.
Doctor: Let me check your temperature.
Patient: I also feel weak.
Doctor: It’s a mild infection. Take this medicine and rest.

fields.title: Денсаулық сақтау жүйесінің артықшылықтары мен кемшіліктері
fields.content:
Some countries have public healthcare, while others use private systems. Public systems are often free or low-cost, but sometimes slow. Private care is faster but more expensive.
In public hospitals, everyone has access. In private hospitals, service is quicker and more comfortable. However, not everyone can afford private treatment.
I believe governments must improve public healthcare, so all citizens get the care they need, no matter their income.
fields.vocabulary:

necessary – қажет
fields.grammar:
Comparing healthcare systems:

– Public care is cheaper but slower.
– Private hospitals offer better service.
– Everyone should have equal access.
fields.dialogue:
Madi: Do you prefer public or private hospitals?
Aliya: Private ones are faster, but public is more affordable.
Madi: I agree. But sometimes public hospitals are too crowded.
Aliya: That’s true. I hope both systems improve in the future.

fields.title: Science, Technology, Sports, Economy, Healthcare
fields.content:
Over the past ten lessons, we explored science, technology, sports, economy, and healthcare. We learned how technology changes society, why sports are important, and how healthcare systems work.
We practiced expressing opinions, comparing systems, and using new words like “inflation”, “preventive care”, and “income”.
Understanding these topics helps us take part in real conversations and stay informed. Language is more than grammar — it’s a tool to learn about the world.
fields.vocabulary:
review – қайталау

explore – зерттеу

society – қоғам

important – маңызды

system – жүйе

opinion – пікір

compare – салыстыру

preventive – алдын алу

income – табыс

economy – экономика

healthcare – денсаулық сақтау

technology – технология

grammar – грамматика

participate – қатысу

understand – түсіну

learn – үйрену

tool – құрал

topic – тақырып

conversation – әңгіме

world – әлем
fields.grammar:
Қайталау үлгілері:

– We have learned a lot about the economy.
– I can describe my symptoms to a doctor now.
– Sports help improve our health.
– Technology has changed how we live
fields.dialogue:
Teacher: What did you enjoy most in this unit?
Student: I liked learning about technology and healthcare.
Teacher: What topic was most difficult?
Student: Understanding economic terms, but now it’s easier.
Teacher: Great job! You’ve made real progress.

fields.kazakh_translation: сен науқассың ба, немесе қанша уақыттан бері науқассың?
Мен сіздің жеке куәлігіңізді көре аламын ба?

fields.english_word: tell me how to get to...

fields.text:
1. A: Hello! How are you?  
   - Сәлем! Қалың қалай?  
   - Сәлемдесу формасы. "Hello" – сәлемдесу үшін қолданылатын сөз. "How are you?" – адамның хал-жағдайын сұрау үшін қолданылады.

2. B: I'm fine, thank you. And you?  
   - Мен жақсымын, рахмет. Ал сен?  
   - "I'm fine, thank you" – жағдайының жақсы екенін білдіру үшін. "And you?" – жауап береді әрі қарсы тараптың жағдайын сұрайды.

3. A: I'm good. My name is Sarah. What is your name?  
   - Мен жақсымын. Менің атым Сара. Сенің атың кім?  
   - "I'm good" – өзінің жағдайын айту. "My name is" – өзін таныстыру үшін қолданылады. "What is your name?" – адамның атын сұрау.

4. B: My name is Alex. Nice to meet you!  
   - Менің атым Алекс. Танысқаныма қуаныштымын!  
   - "My name is" – өзін таныстыру. "Nice to meet you" – алғашқы таныстық кезінде қолданылады, танысқанына қуанғанын білдіреді.

5. A: Nice to meet you too!  
   - Мен де танысқаныма қуаныштымын!  
   - "Nice to meet you too" – қарсы тараптың қуанышын бөлісіп, жауап беру формасы.

Әр сөйлемді түпнұсқада оқып, содан кейін қазақ тіліне аударайық:

1. **Hello! My name is Sarah.**
   - Сәлем! Менің атым Сара.

2. **I am from Kazakhstan.**
   - Мен Қазақстаннанмын.

3. **I speak English and Kazakh.**
   - Мен ағылшын және қазақ тілдерінде сөйлеймін.

4. **I love learning languages.**
   - Мен тіл үйренуді жақсы көремін.

5. **Today, we will learn simple greetings in English.**
   - Бүгін біз ағылшын тілінде қарапайым сәлемдесулерді үйренеміз.

6. **In the morning, you say "Good morning".**
   - Таңертең сіз "Қайырлы таң" дейсіз.

7. **In the afternoon, you say "Good afternoon".**
   - Түстен кейін сіз "Қайырлы күн" дейсіз.

8. **In the evening, you say "Good evening".**
   - Кешке сіз "Қайырлы кеш" дейсіз.

9. **Let's practice these greetings and become friends!**
   - Осы сәлемдесулерді жаттап, дос болайық!

**Сөз тіркестерін талдау:**

- **I love learning languages.**
  - **Love learning** – бұл тіркесте оқып-білуге деген құмарлық немесе ынта білдіріледі.
  - **Languages** – тілдер. Бұл сөздің мағынасы кең, себебі ол тек нақты тілдер емес, жалпы тіл үйрену процесін де қамтиды.

- **Good morning/afternoon/evening**
  - **Good** – жақсы, бұл жерде сәлемдесу мәнінде қолданылған.
  - **Morning/afternoon/evening** – таң/түс/кеш, бұл сөздер күннің әр мезгілін білдіреді.

**Сәлемдесу сөздері:**

Ағылшын тілінде сәлемдесу үшін әртүрлі сөздер қолданылады. Бұл сөздер әртүрлі уақытқа арналған:

1. **Hello** – Кез келген уақытта қолдануға болатын жалпы сәлемдесу.
   - Мысал: Hello, how are you?
   
2. **Good morning** – Таңертеңгі уақытта қолданылады.
   - Мысал: Good morning, everyone!

3. **Good afternoon** – Түстен кейінгі уақытта қолданылады.
   - Мысал: Good afternoon, Mr. Smith.

4. **Good evening** – Кешкі уақытта қолданылады.
   - Мысал: Good evening, Sarah.

**Өзін таныстыру құрылымы:**

Өзіңізді таныстыру үшін "My name is ..." құрылымын қолданамыз. Бұл сіздің есіміңізді айту үшін ең қарапайым тәсіл.

- Мысал: My name is Ali.
- Мысал: My name is Aigerim.

Жиі қателесетін тұстар: Оқушылар кейде "My name's" деген қысқартылған форманы қолданады, бұл да дұрыс.

**"To be" етістігі:**

Бұл етістік ағылшын тілінде жиі қолданылады және қазіргі шақта әртүрлі түрде қолданылады:

1. **I am** – Мен.
   - Мысал: I am a student.
   - Мысал: I am happy.

2. **You are** – Сен немесе сіз.
   - Мысал: You are welcome.
   - Мысал: You are my friend.

3. **He/She/It is** – Ол (ер адам/әйел адам/зат).
   - Мысал: He is a teacher.
   - Мысал: It is a book.

Жиі қателесетін тұстар: Оқушылар кейде "am", "are", "is" сөздерін дұрыс қолданбайды. Мысалы, "He am" немесе "I is" деп қате жібереді.

**Пунктуация:**

Сөйлемнің соңында әрқашан нүкте (.) қойылады. Бұл сөйлемнің аяқталғанын көрсетеді. Сөйлемдер қысқа әрі нақты болуы тиіс.

- Мысал: She is a doctor.
- Мысал: We are at home.

Қосымша түсініктеме: Сұрақ және лепті сөйлемдерде нүктенің орнына сұрақ белгісі (?) немесе леп белгісі (!) қолданылуы мүмкін.

Hello – Сәлем.  
Сәлемдесу үшін қолданылады.  
Мысал: Hello, how are you? – Сәлем, қалайсың?  

My name – Менің атым.  
Өз есіміңізді таныстыру үшін қолданылады.  
Мысал: My name is John. – Менің атым Джон.  

is – болу етістігінің қазіргі шақтағы формасы.  
Ағылшын тілінде заттың немесе адамның күйін, жағдайын білдіреді.  
Мысал: She is a student. – Ол студент.  

Sarah – Сара.  
Адам есімі.  
Мысал: Sarah is my friend. – Сара менің досым.  

I am – Мен …мын.  
Өз жағдайыңызды немесе күйіңізді білдіру үшін қолданылады.  
Мысал: I am happy. – Мен бақыттымын.  

from – –дан, –ден.  
Қайдан екеніңізді білдіру үшін қолданылады.  
Мысал: I am from Canada. – Мен Канададанмын.  

Kazakhstan – Қазақстан.  
Ел атауы.  
Мысал: I live in Kazakhstan. – Мен Қазақстанда тұрамын.  

speak – сөйлеу.  
Тілде сөйлей алу қабілетін білдіреді.  
Мысал: I speak English. – Мен ағылшынша сөйлеймін.  

English – ағылшын тілі.  
Тіл атауы.  
Мысал: English is an international language. – Ағылшын тілі халықаралық тіл.  

Kazakh – қазақ тілі.  
Тіл атауы.  
Мысал: I am learning Kazakh. – Мен қазақ тілін үйреніп жүрмін.  

love – жақсы көру, сүйу.  
Адам не нәрсені қатты ұнататынын білдіреді.  
Мысал: I love chocolate. – Мен шоколадты жақсы көремін.  

learning – үйрену.  
Жаңа дағды не білім алу процесі.  
Мысал: I am learning to play the guitar. – Мен гитарада ойнауды үйреніп жүрмін.  

languages – тілдер.  
Әртүрлі тілдердің атауын білдіреді.  
Мысал: She speaks three languages. – Ол үш тілде сөйлейді.  

Today – Бүгін.  
Ағымдағы күнді білдіреді.  
Мысал: Today is sunny. – Бүгін күн ашық.  

learn – үйрену.  
Жаңа мәлімет не дағды алу әрекеті.  
Мысал: I want to learn French. – Мен француз тілін үйренгім келеді.  

simple – қарапайым.  
Қиын емес, оңай деген мағынада.  
Мысал: This is a simple task. – Бұл оңай тапсырма.  

greetings – сәлемдесу сөздері.  
Адамдармен амандасуға қолданылатын сөздер.  
Мысал: We exchanged greetings. – Біз бір-бірімізбен амандастық.  

in the morning – таңда.  
Күннің алғашқы бөлігі.  
Мысал: I exercise in the morning. – Мен таңертең жаттығу жасаймын.  

Good morning – Қайырлы таң.  
Таңертеңгі амандасу.  
Мысал: Good morning, everyone! – Қайырлы таң, баршаңызға!  

in the afternoon – түстен кейін (күндіз).  
Күннің түстен кейінгі бөлігі.  
Мысал: I have a meeting in the afternoon. – Менің түстен кейін жиналысым бар.  

Good afternoon – Қайырлы күн.  
Түстен кейінгі амандасу.  
Мысал: Good afternoon, sir! – Қайырлы күн, мырза!  

in the evening – кеште.  
Күннің кешкі бөлігі.  
Мысал: We have dinner in the evening. – Біз кешкісін кешкі ас ішеміз.  

Good evening – Қайырлы кеш.  
Кешкі амандасу.  
Мысал: Good evening, how was your day? – Қайырлы кеш, күніңіз қалай өтті?  

Let's practice – Жаттығайық.  
Белгілі бір дағдыны жақсарту үшін бірге әрекет ету.  
Мысал: Let's practice speaking English. – Ағылшынша сөйлеуді жаттығайық.  

become friends – дос болайық.  
Достық қарым-қатынас орнату.  
Мысал: We should become friends. – Біз дос болуымыз керек.

**Hello!**  
Сәлем!

**My name is John.**  
Менің атым Джон.

**I come from a small and happy family.**  
Мен кішкентай және бақытты отбасынан шыққанмын.

**My family consists of four members: my father, my mother, my sister, and me.**  
Менің отбасым төрт адамнан тұрады: әкем, анам, әпкем және мен.

**My father is a teacher and my mother is a doctor.**  
Менің әкем мұғалім, ал анам дәрігер.

**My sister is a student.**  
Менің әпкем студент.

**We often spend our weekends together, enjoying meals and going for walks in the park.**  
Біз демалыс күндерін жиі бірге өткіземіз, тамақтанып, саябақта серуендейміз.

**I love my family very much.**  
Мен өз отбасымды қатты жақсы көремін.

### Сөз тіркестерін талдау:

- **come from**: шыққан жері немесе тегі.
  - Мысалы, "I come from a small and happy family" дегенде, "Мен кішкентай және бақытты отбасынан шыққанмын" деген мағынаны білдіреді.

- **consists of**: тұрады.
  - "My family consists of four members" - "Менің отбасым төрт адамнан тұрады".

- **spend our weekends together**: демалыс күндерін бірге өткізу.
  - Бұл тіркес демалыс уақытын отбасымен бірге өткізу мағынасында қолданылады.

- **enjoying meals**: тамақтанып рахаттану.
  - Бұл тіркес бірге тамақтанып, одан ләззат алу дегенді білдіреді.

- **going for walks**: серуенге шығу.
  - Саябақта немесе басқа жерде серуендеу мағынасын береді.

Бұл мәтін жаңадан ағылшын тілін үйренушілерге отбасы тақырыбында негізгі ақпарат алуға көмектеседі.

1. "Hello! How are you?"
   - Сәлем! Қалыңыз қалай?
